# 19 CONSUMER ADVISORY FOR UNDERCOOKED FOOD
# 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
OBSERVATIONS: Prep unit #2 observed with old food in back of unit in reach-in portion and around hinges on door. Clean today.
Heavy grease accumulation observed on walls, wall vents, ceiling and hood throughout main prep area. REPEAT VIOLATION. Hood does not seem to be able to capture all hood vapors. See #38. All grease must be removed within 48 hours.
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
OBSERVATIONS: Cutting board at prep unit #2 is deteriorated and stained. Resurface, replace or flip over if other side is in good condition. Correct within 7 days.
# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
OBSERVATIONS: Hood ventilation is not available over gas stove with top burners and kitchen is observed with excessive grease and smoke leaving hood. EMD management will be consulted regarding this lack of ventilation and it may be determined that reduction of equipment or additional hood ventilation is required. See #33. Facility will be notified of management decision.

# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN OBSERVATIONS: Thick dust accumulation in hood filters. Clean within 5 days.

# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 14b WAREWASHING AND SANITIZING PROCEDURES
# 19 CONSUMER ADVISORY FOR UNDERCOOKED FOOD
# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
# 32b COMPLIANCE WITH TRANS FAT BAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: No food containing artificial trans fat may be stored, distributed, served by, or used in the preparation of any food within a food facility. Every food facility shall maintain on the premises, the label for any food that contains fat, oil, or shortening, for as long as this food is stored, distributed, served by, or used in the preparation of food within the food facility. Food sold or served in a manufacturer's original sealed package is exempt from this requirement. (114377) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 18 HACCP REQUIREMENTS
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Wiping cloths used to clean food and nonfood-contact surfaces shall be used only once unless kept in clean water with a sanitizer solution of 100 ppm available chlorine or 200 ppm quaternary ammonium. Sponges shall not be used on food-contact surfaces. Except for fabric implements, linen shall not be used in contact with food. (114099.6, 114135, 114185.1, 114185.3 (d-e)). # 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
# 44a PREMISES KEPT FREE OF UNUSED EQUIPMENT
CODE DESCRIPTION: The premises of a food facility shall be kept free of items that are unnecessary to the operation or maintenance of the facility, such as equipment that is nonfunctional or no longer used. (114257.1.) # 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES

# 14b WAREWASHING AND SANITIZING PROCEDURES
# 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Containers holding food or food ingredients that are removed from their original packaging shall be identified with the common name of the food. (114051) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED OBSERVATIONS: Non-commercial Panasonic microwave in kitchen. Replace with commercially approved equipment today.
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES
# 43 RESTROOMS MAINTAINED, SUPPLIED, AND ACCESSIBLE
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 5a HANDWASHING PROCEDURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Employees are required to wash their hands in the following situations: before engaging in food preparation, after touching bare skin, after using the toilet room, after coughing or sneezing, after eating, drinking, or using tobacco, after handling soiled equipment or utensils, as often as necessary during food preparation to prevent cross-contamination, when switching from working with raw to ready to eat foods, before donning gloves, before dispensing or serving food, after engaging in other activities that may contaminate hands. (113952, 113953.3, 113953.4) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

# 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES

# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 26 THAWING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Frozen foods shall be stored or displayed in their frozen state unless being thawed in the following manner: under refrigeration, completely submerged under cold running water with sufficient velocity to flush loose particles, in microwave oven, during the cooking process. (114018, 114020) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING

Facility Name: VAGABOND INNS #244
# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS OBSERVATIONS: One expired food handler card. Correct within 30 days.
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING

# 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
Facility Name: VAGABOND INNS #244
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
CODE DESCRIPTION: Exhaust hoods shall be provided to remove toxic gases, heat, grease, vapors and smoke and be approved by health and building department. Canopy-type hoods shall extend six inches beyond all cooking equipment. All areas shall have sufficient ventilation to facilitate proper food storage. Toilet rooms shall be vented to the outside air by a screened openable window, air shaft, or light-switch activated exhaust fan. Adequate lighting shall be provided in all areas to facilitate cleaning and inspection. Light fixtures in areas where open food is stored, served, prepared, and where utensils are washed shall be of shatterproof construction or protected with light shields. (114149, 114149.1, 114149.2, 114149.3, 114252, 114252.1) # 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
# 44e VERMIN AND ANIMAL EXCLUSION

# 42 GARBAGE AND REFUSE DISPOSAL
# 43 RESTROOMS MAINTAINED, SUPPLIED, AND ACCESSIBLE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Toilet facilities shall be maintained and kept clean. Toilet rooms shall be separated by a well-fitting self-closing door. Toilet tissue shall be provided in a permanently installed dispenser at each toilet. The number of toilet facilities shall be in accordance with local building and plumbing ordinances. Toilet facilities shall be provided for patrons: in establishments with more than 20,000 sq. ft.; establishments offering on-site consumption of food. (114250, 114250.1, 114276) # 44a PREMISES KEPT FREE OF UNUSED EQUIPMENT
CODE DESCRIPTION: The premises of a food facility shall be kept free of items that are unnecessary to the operation or maintenance of the facility, such as equipment that is nonfunctional or no longer used. (114257.1.) # 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES

# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 32a FOOD PRESENTATION AND LABELING

# 26 THAWING METHODS
OBSERVATIONS: NEW Package of raw sausage observed in prep sink in standing water. Food must be thawed under running/draining water, in refrigeration or as part of the cooking process. Once food thaws to 41F is must be refrigerated or prepared. See #7.

# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Containers holding food or food ingredients that are removed from their original packaging shall be identified with the common name of the food. (114051) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED OBSERVATIONS: -Missing sink at end of bar. Replace prior to opening.

# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
# 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED

# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
# 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Steam tables, ice machines, ice bins, food preparation sinks, display cases, walk-in refrigeration units, and other similar equipment that discharge liquid waste shall drain into a floor sink with an air gap or other approved type of receptor. Plumbing and plumbing fixtures shall be maintained so as to prevent contamination, shall be kept clean, fully operative, and in good repair. The potable water supply shall be protected with a backflow or back siphonage protection device. Any hose used for potable water shall be of approved materials, labeled, properly stored, and used for no other purpose. (114171, 114190, 114192, 114193, 114193.1, 114199, 114201, 114269) # 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities shall be fully enclosed in a building consisting of permanent floors, walls, and an overhead structure that meets minimum standards. The walls and ceiling shall be smooth, durable, nonabsorbent, and easily cleanable. Flooring and base coving shall be smooth, durable, and made of approved nonabsorbent material that is easily cleanable. Floor surfaces shall be coved at the juncture of the floor and wall with a 3/8 inch minimum radius and shall extend up the wall at least 4 inches. (114143 (d), 114266, 114268, 114268.1, 114271, 114272) # 51 PERMIT SUSPENSION

o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
CODE DESCRIPTION: Exhaust hoods shall be provided to remove toxic gases, heat, grease, vapors and smoke and be approved by health and building department. Canopy-type hoods shall extend six inches beyond all cooking equipment. All areas shall have sufficient ventilation to facilitate proper food storage. Toilet rooms shall be vented to the outside air by a screened openable window, air shaft, or light-switch activated exhaust fan. Adequate lighting shall be provided in all areas to facilitate cleaning and inspection. Light fixtures in areas where open food is stored, served, prepared, and where utensils are washed shall be of shatterproof construction or protected with light shields. (114149, 114149.1, 114149.2, 114149.3, 114252, 114252.1) # 42 GARBAGE AND REFUSE DISPOSAL
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 1a DEMONSTRATION OF KNOWLEDGE
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING

Facility Name: KFC #105
# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED

# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
OBSERVATIONS: Ants observed near floor sink under the three compartment sink. Remove ants within 24 hours. The church has food and cabinets that are not used by the school. Ensure that all these cabinets are cleaned like the coffee, spices, etc. This will help eliminate the ant issue. See #45 regarding sealing all gaps to prevent vermin entrance.

# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

Facility Name: CARL'S JR RESTAURANT #7051
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 1a DEMONSTRATION OF KNOWLEDGE
# 8 TIME AS A PUBLIC HEALTH CONTROL
CODE DESCRIPTION: When time as a public health control is used, the following procedures shall be observed: food items shall be marked to indicate four hours past the time when the food was removed from temperature control, food shall be served or discarded within the four-hour time limit, written procedures for food that was prepared, cooked, and refrigerated before time as a public health control was used, shall be maintained at the food facility and be made available to the enforcement agency upon request. (114000) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION

Facility Name: JAMBA JUICE #812
Address: 1689 ARDEN WAY # 1112
# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
Facility Name: JAMBA JUICE #812
Address: 1689 ARDEN WAY # 1112

# 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION

# 1a DEMONSTRATION OF KNOWLEDGE
# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS

Facility Name: CINNABON #80
# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Containers holding food or food ingredients that are removed from their original packaging shall be identified with the common name of the food. (114051) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS

# 13 FOOD IN GOOD CONDITION, SAFE, AND UNADULTERATED
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 42 GARBAGE AND REFUSE DISPOSAL

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 9 COOLING METHODS
# 13 FOOD IN GOOD CONDITION, SAFE, AND UNADULTERATED
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
OBSERVATIONS: Observed black mold-like growth on ice machine deflector plate where it has been cracked (see #35). Empty ice and wash, rinse, sanitize and air dry before refilling. Correct within 3 days.
# 14b WAREWASHING AND SANITIZING PROCEDURES
# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Containers holding food or food ingredients that are removed from their original packaging shall be identified with the common name of the food. (114051) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
Facility Name: DEL TACO INC #140
# 8 TIME AS A PUBLIC HEALTH CONTROL
# 4 EATING, DRINKING, OR TOBACCO USE
# 5a HANDWASHING PROCEDURES
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
Facility Name: DEL TACO INC #140
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 31 CONSUMER SELF-SERVICE OPERATIONS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Raw, non-prepackaged food of animal origin, such as beef, lamb, pork, poultry, and eviscerated fish, shall not be offered for consumer self-service. Consumer self-service operations for ready-to-eat foods such as buffets and salad bars shall be provided with a suitable food dispensing utensil for each container displayed or effective dispensing methods that protect the food from contamination. Except for drinking cups, food employees and consumers shall not be allowed to use soiled tableware, including single-use articles, to obtain additional food from the display and servicing equipment. Consumer self-service bulk beverages shall be dispensed in approved manner. (114063 (a,d), 114065, 114075) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED

# 9 COOLING METHODS
# 13 FOOD IN GOOD CONDITION, SAFE, AND UNADULTERATED
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 26 THAWING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Frozen foods shall be stored or displayed in their frozen state unless being thawed in the following manner: under refrigeration, completely submerged under cold running water with sufficient velocity to flush loose particles, in microwave oven, during the cooking process. (114018, 114020) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Containers holding food or food ingredients that are removed from their original packaging shall be identified with the common name of the food. (114051) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS
OBSERVATIONS: pH strips to measure vinegar water concentration holding in use rice scoops were not provided. REPEAT VIOLATION (Also, see violation #36)
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
OBSERVATIONS: - Rice scoops sitting inside standing water 46F. Store in sanitary manner in between use. Store scoops at or below 41F (in ice) or in pH adjusted water (vinegar) with pH 4.6 or below. Water was replaced and adjusted with vinegar (4.6ph) during inspection. REPEAT VIOLATION (Also, see violation #34)

# 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
OBSERVATIONS: Overfilled containers with jack cheese 59F, cheddar cheese 59F-60F, sliced tomatoes 57F, and diced tomatoes 57F stored at cold top cooler that is located next to handwash station. Per employee, all food was placed inside reach-in cooler at about 10:30am and previously was stored at 6-door cooler #3 & #5. Ambient temperature inside cooler was 38F. Do not overfill insert containers; store about 2/3 full. Train employees to practice diligent preparation by taking out what will be used or worked at one time. Employee lowered about of food during inspection.

# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Wiping cloths used to clean food and nonfood-contact surfaces shall be used only once unless kept in clean water with a sanitizer solution of 100 ppm available chlorine or 200 ppm quaternary ammonium. Sponges shall not be used on food-contact surfaces. Except for fabric implements, linen shall not be used in contact with food. (114099.6, 114135, 114185.1, 114185.3 (d-e)). # 44a PREMISES KEPT FREE OF UNUSED EQUIPMENT
CODE DESCRIPTION: The premises of a food facility shall be kept free of items that are unnecessary to the operation or maintenance of the facility, such as equipment that is nonfunctional or no longer used. (114257.1.) # 44e VERMIN AND ANIMAL EXCLUSION

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 4 EATING, DRINKING, OR TOBACCO USE

CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. # 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 26 THAWING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Frozen foods shall be stored or displayed in their frozen state unless being thawed in the following manner: under refrigeration, completely submerged under cold running water with sufficient velocity to flush loose particles, in microwave oven, during the cooking process. (114018, 114020) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Wiping cloths used to clean food and nonfood-contact surfaces shall be used only once unless kept in clean water with a sanitizer solution of 100 ppm available chlorine or 200 ppm quaternary ammonium. Sponges shall not be used on food-contact surfaces. Except for fabric implements, linen shall not be used in contact with food. (114099.6, 114135, 114185.1, 114185.3 (d-e)). # 44e VERMIN AND ANIMAL EXCLUSION

# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 44e VERMIN AND ANIMAL EXCLUSION
# 47a SIGNS POSTED AS REQUIRED
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 4 EATING, DRINKING, OR TOBACCO USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Employees shall not eat, drink, or use tobacco in any area where contamination of food, clean equipment and utensils, linens, and single use articles may occur. Employees may drink from closed beverage container if the container is handled to prevent contamination of the employee's hands, the container, nonprepackaged food, and food-contact surfaces. Area designated for employees to eat and drink shall be located so that food, clean equipment and utensils, linens, and single-use articles are protected from contamination. (113977, 114256 (a)) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)

# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
# 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
# 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
sliced tomatoes / cold top #2 / 39.00 ºF ham / cooler / 35.00 ºF gravy / warmer / 155.00 ºF pooled eggs / ice bath / 38.00 ºF shelled eggs / cold top / 37.00 ºF
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 8 TIME AS A PUBLIC HEALTH CONTROL
CODE DESCRIPTION: When time as a public health control is used, the following procedures shall be observed: food items shall be marked to indicate four hours past the time when the food was removed from temperature control, food shall be served or discarded within the four-hour time limit, written procedures for food that was prepared, cooked, and refrigerated before time as a public health control was used, shall be maintained at the food facility and be made available to the enforcement agency upon request. (114000) # 26 THAWING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Frozen foods shall be stored or displayed in their frozen state unless being thawed in the following manner: under refrigeration, completely submerged under cold running water with sufficient velocity to flush loose particles, in microwave oven, during the cooking process. (114018, 114020) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
CODE DESCRIPTION: Exhaust hoods shall be provided to remove toxic gases, heat, grease, vapors and smoke and be approved by health and building department. Canopy-type hoods shall extend six inches beyond all cooking equipment. All areas shall have sufficient ventilation to facilitate proper food storage. Toilet rooms shall be vented to the outside air by a screened openable window, air shaft, or light-switch activated exhaust fan. Adequate lighting shall be provided in all areas to facilitate cleaning and inspection. Light fixtures in areas where open food is stored, served, prepared, and where utensils are washed shall be of shatterproof construction or protected with light shields. (114149, 114149.1, 114149.2, 114149.3, 114252, 114252.1) # 44b APPROPRIATE USE OF EQUIPMENT
CODE DESCRIPTION: Employees shall not clean their hands in a sink used for food preparation, warewashing, or in a service sink or a curbed cleaning facility used for the disposal of mop water and similar liquid waste. A handwashing facility shall not be used for purposes other than handwashing. Food preparation sinks, handwashing lavatories, and warewashing equipment shall not be used for the cleaning of maintenance tools, the preparation or holding of maintenance materials, or the disposal of mop water and similar liquid wastes. Open-air barbecue or outdoor wood-burning oven shall be operated on the same premises as, in reasonable proximity to, and in conjunction with, a permanent food facility that is approved for food preparation. (113953.1 (b-d), 114123, 114143 (a,b), Exception 114125) # 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES

# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED

o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
# 44d EMPLOYEE PERSONAL ITEMS
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 9 COOLING METHODS
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
OBSERVATIONS: Cartons of single service milk stored on the floor in the walk in cooler #2. Relocate today.
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
OBSERVATIONS: Gaskets at walk in coolers #2 and #3 are deteriorated. Replace within 14 days. REPEAT VIOLATION.
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

# 9 COOLING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be rapidly cooled from 135F to 70F within 2 hours, and then from 70F to 41F within 4 hours. Cooling shall be by one or more of the following methods: in shallow containers, separating food into smaller portions, adding ice as an ingredient, using an ice bath, stirring frequently, using rapid cooling equipment, or using containers that facilitate heat transfer. (114002, 114002.1) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION

Facility Name: MCDONALD'S #17216
# 1a DEMONSTRATION OF KNOWLEDGE
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 8 TIME AS A PUBLIC HEALTH CONTROL
CODE DESCRIPTION: When time as a public health control is used, the following procedures shall be observed: food items shall be marked to indicate four hours past the time when the food was removed from temperature control, food shall be served or discarded within the four-hour time limit, written procedures for food that was prepared, cooked, and refrigerated before time as a public health control was used, shall be maintained at the food facility and be made available to the enforcement agency upon request. (114000) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
Facility Name: MCDONALD'S #17216

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 13 FOOD IN GOOD CONDITION, SAFE, AND UNADULTERATED

o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 13 FOOD IN GOOD CONDITION, SAFE, AND UNADULTERATED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Employees shall not commit any act that may cause the contamination or adulteration of food or food contact surfaces. Food shall be produced, prepared, stored, transported, and served, so as to be free from adulteration and spoilage. Food is considered adulterated if it bears or contains any poisonous or deleterious substance that may render it impure or injurious to health. Containers previously used to store poisonous or toxic materials shall not be used to store food, utensils, or single-use articles. Utensils used for tasting shall be discarded or washed, rinsed, and sanitized between tastings. Ice used as a medium for cooling food and beverages shall not be offered for consumption. Food shall be inspected upon receipt and prior to any use, storage, or resale. (113967, 113976, 113980, 113988, 113990, 114035, 114167, 114254.3) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 44e VERMIN AND ANIMAL EXCLUSION

OBSERVATIONS: Probe thermometer (labeled as #3) is not calibrated. Calibrate thermometer within 24 hours.

# 8 TIME AS A PUBLIC HEALTH CONTROL
# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 9 COOLING METHODS
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
# 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES
CODE DESCRIPTION: An accurate easily readable metal probe thermometer suitable for measuring temperature of food shall be available to the food handler. Thermometers shall be calibrated in accordance with manufacturer's specifications as necessary to ensure their accuracy. A thermometer shall be provided for all refrigerators, hot and cold holding units, and high temperature warewashing machines. (114157, 114159) # 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Wiping cloths used to clean food and nonfood-contact surfaces shall be used only once unless kept in clean water with a sanitizer solution of 100 ppm available chlorine or 200 ppm quaternary ammonium. Sponges shall not be used on food-contact surfaces. Except for fabric implements, linen shall not be used in contact with food. (114099.6, 114135, 114185.1, 114185.3 (d-e)). # 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
# 44d EMPLOYEE PERSONAL ITEMS
# 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES

# 9 COOLING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be rapidly cooled from 135F to 70F within 2 hours, and then from 70F to 41F within 4 hours. Cooling shall be by one or more of the following methods: in shallow containers, separating food into smaller portions, adding ice as an ingredient, using an ice bath, stirring frequently, using rapid cooling equipment, or using containers that facilitate heat transfer. (114051) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN OBSERVATIONS: Unused exhaust hood observed with grease accumulation. Correct and maintain within 14 days.

# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Wiping cloths used to clean food and nonfood-contact surfaces shall be used only once unless kept in clean water with a sanitizer solution of 100 ppm available chlorine or 200 ppm quaternary ammonium. Sponges shall not be used on food-contact surfaces. Except for fabric implements, linen shall not be used in contact with food. (114099.6, 114135, 114185.1, 114185.3 (d-e)). # 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION

# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Wiping cloths used to clean food and nonfood-contact surfaces shall be used only once unless kept in clean water with a sanitizer solution of 100 ppm available chlorine or 200 ppm quaternary ammonium. # 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN OBSERVATIONS: Areas observed with old food/grease/residue like accumulation:

o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 43 RESTROOMS MAINTAINED, SUPPLIED, AND ACCESSIBLE
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 42 GARBAGE AND REFUSE DISPOSAL
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
American cheese slices/prep line cold top/48 degrees f; ham slices/prep line cold top/44 degrees f. Improper holding temperature. 2nd Repeat violation. Move food to another refrigerator. This unit unable to maintain food temperatures at 41 degrees f and below. see item #35

# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

Facility Name: SUBWAY #11234
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
OBSERVATIONS: Teriyaki chicken /prep line cold top/53 degrees f; chicken breast/prep line cold top/55 degrees f; steak/prep line cold top/54 degrees f; Improper holding temperature. Per discussion with staff all food items listed above, were held in the cold top since 9am this morning. All food items exceeded the 4 hour cold holding time frame and were voluntarily discarded. Per staff this section of the cold top is not working, and so ice is being placed within the compartment to provide an ice bath. Per discussion with staff, ice was last added to the compartment at 9am this morning. Directed staff to add fresh ice every 2 hours, and to monitor the temperature of the foods held in this section. Potentially hazardous food shall be held at 41 degrees f and below. See item #35

# 43 RESTROOMS MAINTAINED, SUPPLIED, AND ACCESSIBLE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Toilet facilities shall be maintained and kept clean. Toilet rooms shall be separated by a well-fitting self-closing door. Toilet tissue shall be provided in a permanently installed dispenser at each toilet. The number of toilet facilities shall be in accordance with local building and plumbing ordinances. Toilet facilities shall be provided for patrons: in establishments with more than 20,000 sq. ft.; establishments offering on-site consumption of food. # 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
OBSERVATIONS: Large container of cooked garlic in oil, observed on shelf below bread toaster in kitchen #1, measured 70F. Per cook, it was made 3 hours prior and left out on shelf without cooling intervention. Corrected by relocating to refrigeration. Education provided. NOTE: ambient room temperature measured 70F. *pots de creme stored in non refrigerated dessert case measured 65F. Per employee, it was out of temperature for 20 minutes. Corrected by relocating to refrigeration. NOTE: if item is for display only, it must be labeled.
MINOR VIOLATION The following items were out of proper holding temperature: *Sliced ham in cold top insert in kitchen #1 measured 50F. Corrected by adding ice pack. *cooked noodle salad in cold drawer in kitchen #2 measured 46F. Correct immediately. *quinoa, cooked egg, house made dressings in cold top insert in kitchen #2 measured 44F to 50F. Correct immediately.

# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION

CODE DESCRIPTION: Wiping cloths used to clean food and nonfood-contact surfaces shall be used only once unless kept in clean water with a sanitizer solution of 100 ppm available chlorine or 200 ppm quaternary ammonium. Sponges shall not be used on food-contact surfaces. Except for fabric implements, linen shall not be used in contact with food. (114099.6, 114135, 114185.1, 114185.3 (d-e)). # 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES

# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 32a FOOD PRESENTATION AND LABELING

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 47a SIGNS POSTED AS REQUIRED

# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION

# 1a DEMONSTRATION OF KNOWLEDGE
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 14b WAREWASHING AND SANITIZING PROCEDURES

# 1a DEMONSTRATION OF KNOWLEDGE
# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 4 EATING, DRINKING, OR TOBACCO USE
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 14b WAREWASHING AND SANITIZING PROCEDURES
# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
