# 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
# 44a PREMISES KEPT FREE OF UNUSED EQUIPMENT
# 44c MOP SINK AND JANITORIAL AREA
CODE DESCRIPTION: At least one janitorial sink equipped with hot and cold water and a drain shall be provided and conveniently located for the cleaning of mops or similar wet floor cleaning tools and for the disposal of mop water and similar liquid waste. A room, area, or cabinet separated from food preparation, food storage, or warewashing shall be provided for the storage of cleaning equipment and supplies. After use, mops shall be placed in a position that allows them to air-dry without soiling walls, equipment, or supplies. (114279, 114281, 114282) # 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities shall be fully enclosed in a building consisting of permanent floors, walls, and an overhead structure that meets minimum standards. The walls and ceiling shall be smooth, durable, nonabsorbent, and easily cleanable. Flooring and base coving shall be smooth, durable, and made of approved nonabsorbent material that is easily cleanable. Floor surfaces shall be coved at the juncture of the floor and wall with a 3/8 inch minimum radius and shall extend up the wall at least 4 inches. (114143 (d), 114266, 114268, 114268.1, 114271, 114272) # 50 IMPOUNDMENT OF FOOD, UTENSILS, AND EQUIPMENT
See #13

# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Steam tables, ice machines, ice bins, food preparation sinks, display cases, walk-in refrigeration units, and other similar equipment that discharge liquid waste shall drain into a floor sink with an air gap or other approved type of receptor. Plumbing and plumbing fixtures shall be maintained so as to prevent contamination, shall be kept clean, fully operative, and in good repair. The potable water supply shall be protected with a backflow or back siphonage protection device. Any hose used for potable water shall be of approved materials, labeled, properly stored, and used for no other purpose. (114171, 114190, 114192, 114193, 114193.1, 114199, 114201, 114269) # 44a PREMISES KEPT FREE OF UNUSED EQUIPMENT

# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
Observed the following German cockroach activity: -1 dying adult under the affect of insect growth regulator running along electrical conduit behind 1-door upright reach-in located next to hood ventilation. Cockroach ran into gap between wall and shelving unit used to store togo drink cups that are sealed inside manufacturer packaging. -2 dead nymphs on counter beside unapproved household Kitchen Aid mixer in the same area. -1 dead adult on bottom shelf below Kitchen Aid mixer. -1 dead nymph on wall above cold-top unit. -1 dead nymph in hole of stainless steel wall behind cold-top unit where walk-in cooler drain hose comes out. -1 dying nymph on floor below cold-top unit. Cockroach was killed at the time of inspection. -1 egg casing in floor sink located under cold-top unit (see #33). Clean all dead bodies within 24 hours.

# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY

# 14b WAREWASHING AND SANITIZING PROCEDURES
# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

# 1a DEMONSTRATION OF KNOWLEDGE
OBSERVATIONS: Operator did not demonstrate acceptable food safety knowledge on proper warewashing. Observed hose with sprayer attached to handwash sink at donut prep area. Also, found multi-use utensils stored on drain board of this sink. Per operator, they have hose attached to this sink because utensils and some other food equipment is washed at this sink. Cease practice immediately. Handwashing sink shall be used only to wash hands. Use 2-comp warewash sink in the back area to wash, rinse, sanitize and air dry all utensils and food contact equipment (pans, bowls, etc.). Ensure all employees are adequately trained in all aspects of food safety. (Also, see violation #6)

o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
1. MAJOR VIOLATION: Handwash sink was completely blocked by small mats next to ice machine. Corrected. (#6)
2. Facility was able to provide only a copy of completed food manager certificate. Maintain original certificate on-site at all times. Correct within 7 days. Second notification. (#1b)
3. Boxes with syrups and juice stored on the floor next to mop sink inside water heater room. Keep beverages at least 6 inches off the floor and relocate away from mop sink (away from possible contamination source) or provide splash guard. Correct today. REPEAT VIOLATION (#30a)
4. Drain pipes were nesting inside bar floor sinks. Corrected. (#41)
5. Men's restroom door does not self-close completely. Repair/adjust to self-close completely within 5 days. (#43)
6. Found holes in ceiling inside water heater room that exceed 1/4 inch. Eliminate gaps to prevent vermin entry within 30 days. REPEAT VIOLATION (#43e)
7. Employee open beverage was stored on clean side of warewash sink and then was relocated on top of ice bin. All employee beverages in food prep areas must be stored in a cup with lid and straw, and located away from food. Corrected. (#4)

Facility Name: BURGER KING #7469
# 8 TIME AS A PUBLIC HEALTH CONTROL
CODE DESCRIPTION: When time as a public health control is used, the following procedures shall be observed: food items shall be marked to indicate four hours past the time when the food was removed from temperature control, food shall be served or discarded within the four-hour time limit, written procedures for food that was prepared, cooked, and refrigerated before time as a public health control was used, shall be maintained at the food facility and be made available to the enforcement agency upon request. (114000) # 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
Address: 8451 ELK GROVE BLVD, #3
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 16 SHELLSTOCK IDENTIFICATION TAGS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Shellstock shall be obtained in containers that bear legible source identification tags. Shellstock tags shall remain attached to the container that they are received in until the container is empty. Shellstock tags shall be maintained at the food facility in chronological order correlating to the sale date for 90 calendar days from the date of harvest. The source of the shellstock on display shall be identified. Shellstock that are portioned or prepackaged shall have a copy of the corresponding shellstock tag. (114039, 114039.1, 114039.3, 114039.4) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED

# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
CODE DESCRIPTION: Exhaust hoods shall be provided to remove toxic gases, heat, grease, vapors and smoke and be approved by health and building department. Canopy-type hoods shall extend six inches beyond all cooking equipment. All areas shall have sufficient ventilation to facilitate proper food storage. Toilet rooms shall be vented to the outside air by a screened openable window, air shaft, or light-switch activated exhaust fan. Adequate lighting shall be provided in all areas to facilitate cleaning and inspection. Light fixtures in areas where open food is stored, served, prepared, and where utensils are washed shall be of shatterproof construction or protected with light shields. (114149, 114149.1, 114149.2, 114149.3, 114252, 114252.1) # 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES
CODE DESCRIPTION: An accurate easily readable metal probe thermometer suitable for measuring temperature of food shall be available to the food handler. Thermometers shall be calibrated in accordance with manufacturer's specifications as necessary to ensure their accuracy. A thermometer shall be provided for all refrigerators, hot and cold holding units, and high temperature warewashing machines. (114157, 114159) # 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)

# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN OBSERVATIONS: Rust build-up is observed on bottom shelf of prep table. Clean and remove rust within 7 days.

# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS OBSERVATIONS: California food handler card for 1 employee has expired. Re-new within 15 days. (REPEAT VIOLATION)

# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
# 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Steam tables, ice machines, ice bins, food preparation sinks, display cases, walk-in refrigeration units, and other similar equipment that discharge liquid waste shall drain into a floor sink with an air gap or other approved type of receptor. Plumbing and plumbing fixtures shall be maintained so as to prevent contamination, shall be kept clean, fully operative, and in good repair. The potable water supply shall be protected with a backflow or back siphonage protection device. Any hose used for potable water shall be of approved materials, labeled, properly stored, and used for no other purpose. (114171, 114190, 114192, 114193, 114193.1, 114199, 114201, 114269) # 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)

# 1a DEMONSTRATION OF KNOWLEDGE
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED

# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 49 PERMIT REQUIREMENTS

# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Containers holding food or food ingredients that are removed from their original packaging shall be identified with the common name of the food. (114051) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED

#27) REARRANGE RAW SHELL EGGS BELOW VEGETABLES TO PREVENT CROSS CONTAMINATION. CORRECT

# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
# 43 RESTROOMS MAINTAINED, SUPPLIED, AND ACCESSIBLE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Toilet facilities shall be maintained and kept clean. Toilet rooms shall be separated by a well-fitting self-closing door. Toilet tissue shall be provided in a permanently installed dispenser at each toilet. The number of toilet facilities shall be in accordance with local building and plumbing ordinances. Toilet facilities shall be provided for patrons: in establishments with more than 20,000 sq. ft.; establishments offering on-site consumption of food. (114250, 114250.1, 114276) # 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION

# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
Facility Name: JIMBOY'S TACOS #27
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
Facility Name: JIMBOY'S TACOS #27

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 4 EATING, DRINKING, OR TOBACCO USE
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 43 RESTROOMS MAINTAINED, SUPPLIED, AND ACCESSIBLE

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
# 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
# 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
OBSERVATIONS: - Saute onions 95F-118F and saute peppers 130F inside hot bath on the stove. Food items have been reheated above 165F. - Overfilled container with sliced cheese 54F-56F inside cold top cooler across from handwash sink. Extra food was removed. - Tub with whipped butter 55F-56F stored on top of melted ice at server's area. Butter was relocated inside reach-in cooler. Minor Violation: - Overfilled container with sliced tomatoes, blue cheese crumbles and feta cheese 46F stored inside cold top cooler across from handwash sink. - Overfilled container with grilled chicken 50F, sliced turkey 50F, and boiled eggs 46F stored inside salad prep cold top cooler. - Overfilled container with alfalfa sprouts 46F stored inside cold top cooler next to flat grill. - Polenta, chicken breast, diced meat, ham, several containers with pasta were at 48F at reach-in cooler across from stove top. Also, meatballs, diced sausages, diced ham, chorizo, and chicken 44F-46F at cold top cooler across from stove top. Ambient temperature of this cooler was 50F-54F. (Also, see violation #35)

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 9 COOLING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be rapidly cooled from 135F to 70F within 2 hours, and then from 70F to 41F within 4 hours. Cooling shall be by one or more of the following methods: in shallow containers, separating food into smaller portions, adding ice as an ingredient, using an ice bath, stirring frequently, using rapid cooling equipment, or using containers that facilitate heat transfer. (114002, 114002.1) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED

# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION

CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED

# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 32a FOOD PRESENTATION AND LABELING
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
# 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES
# 43 RESTROOMS MAINTAINED, SUPPLIED, AND ACCESSIBLE
# 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES

# 9 COOLING METHODS
# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
# 4 EATING, DRINKING, OR TOBACCO USE
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
OBSERVATIONS: Baked potato 44F, Greek lasagna 45F-46F, diced tomatoes 45F-46F, gyro meat 45F, hummus 43F stored on the right side of 3-door reach-in cooler (away from condenser unit). Note that all food on the left side near condenser was stored at 40F. All food must be stored at/below 41F at all times. Corrected by relocating food to another cooler. DO NOT STORE FOOD ON THE RIGHT SIDE OF THIS COOLER. (Also, see violation #35) REPEAT VIOLATION

# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED OBSERVATIONS: Bulk food containers lacked labels. Correct within two days.

# 49 PERMIT REQUIREMENTS
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 1a DEMONSTRATION OF KNOWLEDGE
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 32a FOOD PRESENTATION AND LABELING
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food offered for human consumption shall be honestly presented in a way that does not mislead or misinform the consumer. Food packaged in a food facility shall bear a label that complies with the labeling requirements prescribed by the Sherman Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Law which include: common name of the food, ingredients list, quantity of contents, name and address of manufacturer, nutritional information as specified in 21 C.F.R. (114087, 114088, 114089, 114089.1(a, b), 114090, 114093.1) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS

# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
# 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES

# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES
CODE DESCRIPTION: An accurate easily readable metal probe thermometer suitable for measuring temperature of food shall be available to the food handler. Thermometers shall be calibrated in accordance with manufacturer's specifications as necessary to ensure their accuracy. A thermometer shall be provided for all refrigerators, hot and cold holding units, and high temperature warewashing machines. (114157, 114159) # 47a SIGNS POSTED AS REQUIRED

CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION OBSERVATIONS: FLIES (10 QTY) OBSERVED THROUGHOUT FOOD KITCHEN AREA. ELIMINATE FLIES FROM THIS AREA.
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 32a FOOD PRESENTATION AND LABELING

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
# 43 RESTROOMS MAINTAINED, SUPPLIED, AND ACCESSIBLE
# 44c MOP SINK AND JANITORIAL AREA
CODE DESCRIPTION: At least one janitorial sink equipped with hot and cold water and a drain shall be provided and conveniently located for the cleaning of mops or similar wet floor cleaning tools and for the disposal of mop water and similar liquid waste. A room, area, or cabinet separated from food preparation, food storage, or warewashing shall be provided for the storage of cleaning equipment and supplies. After use, mops shall be placed in a position that allows them to air-dry without soiling walls, equipment, or supplies. (114279, 114281, 114282) # 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)

CODE DESCRIPTION: Containers holding food or food ingredients that are removed from their original packaging shall be identified with the common name of the food. (114051) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN OBSERVATIONS: Floor below cooking equipment and in both walk-in units unclean with old food accumulation. Clean within 3 days.

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 32a FOOD PRESENTATION AND LABELING
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
# 42 GARBAGE AND REFUSE DISPOSAL
# 49 PERMIT REQUIREMENTS

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 26 THAWING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Frozen foods shall be stored or displayed in their frozen state unless being thawed in the following manner: under refrigeration, completely submerged under cold running water with sufficient velocity to flush loose particles, in microwave oven, during the cooking process. (114018, 114020) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION

o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 8 TIME AS A PUBLIC HEALTH CONTROL
CODE DESCRIPTION: When time as a public health control is used, the following procedures shall be observed: food items shall be marked to indicate four hours past the time when the food was removed from temperature control, food shall be served or discarded within the four-hour time limit, written procedures for food that was prepared, cooked, and refrigerated before time as a public health control was used, shall be maintained at the food facility and be made available to the enforcement agency upon request. (114000) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED

# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED

# 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES
x Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED

# 11 REHEATING PROCEDURES FOR HOT HOLDING
# 1a DEMONSTRATION OF KNOWLEDGE
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 44d EMPLOYEE PERSONAL ITEMS

# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION OBSERVATIONS: Bag of red cups stored on the floor in the back area. Store 6 inches off the floor.

# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. # 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
# 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES

# 42 GARBAGE AND REFUSE DISPOSAL
# 44c MOP SINK AND JANITORIAL AREA
# 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES

# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 8 TIME AS A PUBLIC HEALTH CONTROL
# 5a HANDWASHING PROCEDURES
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Containers holding food or food ingredients that are removed from their original packaging shall be identified with the common name of the food. (114051) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS OBSERVATIONS: Sanitizer measured 50ppm in sanitizer basin of 3-compartment sink. Replace today.
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES
CODE DESCRIPTION: An accurate easily readable metal probe thermometer suitable for measuring temperature of food shall be available to the food handler. Thermometers shall be calibrated in accordance with manufacturer's specifications as necessary to ensure their accuracy. A thermometer shall be provided for all refrigerators, hot and cold holding units, and high temperature warewashing machines. (114157, 114159) # 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Wiping cloths used to clean food and nonfood-contact surfaces shall be used only once unless kept in clean water with a sanitizer solution of 100 ppm available chlorine or 200 ppm quaternary ammonium. Sponges shall not be used on food-contact surfaces. Except for fabric implements, linen shall not be used in contact with food. (114099.6, 114135, 114185.1, 114185.3 (d-e)). # 43 RESTROOMS MAINTAINED, SUPPLIED, AND ACCESSIBLE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Toilet facilities shall be maintained and kept clean. Toilet rooms shall be separated by a well-fitting self-closing door. Toilet tissue shall be provided in a permanently installed dispenser at each toilet. The number of toilet facilities shall be in accordance with local building and plumbing ordinances. Toilet facilities shall be provided for patrons: in establishments with more than 20,000 sq. ft.; establishments offering on-site consumption of food. (114250, 114250.1, 114276) # 47a SIGNS POSTED AS REQUIRED

# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
Address: 9545 FOLSOM BLVD # 2
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 14b WAREWASHING AND SANITIZING PROCEDURES
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
# 42 GARBAGE AND REFUSE DISPOSAL

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 5a HANDWASHING PROCEDURES
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
# 25 PERSONAL CLEANLINESS AND HAIR RESTRAINT
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food employees shall wear clean outer clothing to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Employees preparing, serving or handling food or utensils shall wear hair restraints such as hats, hair coverings, or nets. Food employees shall keep their fingernails trimmed, filed, and maintained or shall wear gloves when contacting food and food-contact surfaces. (113968, 113969, 113971, 113973) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
OBSERVATIONS: Hot dog and turkey sandwich stored in merchandiser door #1 measured 43F. Rapidly cool to 41F or below today.
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 43 RESTROOMS MAINTAINED, SUPPLIED, AND ACCESSIBLE

CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

# 1a DEMONSTRATION OF KNOWLEDGE
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED

# 5a HANDWASHING PROCEDURES
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION

Facility Name: CARL'S JR RESTAURANT#8739
# 5a HANDWASHING PROCEDURES
# 13 FOOD IN GOOD CONDITION, SAFE, AND UNADULTERATED
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

Facility Name: ROUND TABLE PIZZA #573
# 1a DEMONSTRATION OF KNOWLEDGE
# 31 CONSUMER SELF-SERVICE OPERATIONS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Raw, non-prepackaged food of animal origin, such as beef, lamb, pork, poultry, and eviscerated fish, shall not be offered for consumer self-service. Consumer self-service operations for ready-to-eat foods such as buffets and salad bars shall be provided with a suitable food dispensing utensil for each container displayed or effective dispensing methods that protect the food from contamination. Except for drinking cups, food employees and consumers shall not be allowed to use soiled tableware, including single-use articles, to obtain additional food from the display and servicing equipment. Consumer self-service bulk beverages shall be dispensed in approved manner. (114063 (a,d), 114065, 114075) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
Facility Name: ROUND TABLE PIZZA #573

o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

# 5a HANDWASHING PROCEDURES
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
Facility Name: YUM YUM DONUTS #614-B
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Wiping cloths used to clean food and nonfood-contact surfaces shall be used only once unless kept in clean water with a sanitizer solution of 100 ppm available chlorine or 200 ppm quaternary ammonium. Sponges shall not be used on food-contact surfaces. Except for fabric implements, linen shall not be used in contact with food. (114099.6, 114135, 114185.1, 114185.3 (d-e)). # 42 GARBAGE AND REFUSE DISPOSAL
Facility Name: YUM YUM DONUTS #614-B

# 32a FOOD PRESENTATION AND LABELING
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food offered for human consumption shall be honestly presented in a way that does not mislead or misinform the consumer. Food packaged in a food facility shall bear a label that complies with the labeling requirements prescribed by the Sherman Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Law which include: common name of the food, ingredients list, quantity of contents, name and address of manufacturer, nutritional information as specified in 21 C.F.R. (114087, 114088, 114089, 114089.1(a, b), 114090, 114093.1) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 44a PREMISES KEPT FREE OF UNUSED EQUIPMENT
CODE DESCRIPTION: The premises of a food facility shall be kept free of items that are unnecessary to the operation or maintenance of the facility, such as equipment that is nonfunctional or no longer used. (114257.1.) # 44e VERMIN AND ANIMAL EXCLUSION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be constructed, equipped, and maintained as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to, rodents and insects. Doors opening to outside air shall have a self-closing device and have no gaps greater than 1/4 inch when closed. Insect control devices shall be installed so that the devices are not located over a food or utensil handling areas. Pass-thru windows shall be of an approved size and be equipped with a self-closing device and air curtain if required. (114259, 114259.2, 114259.3) # 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
Facility Name: LA ESPERANZA #2
# 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Containers holding food or food ingredients that are removed from their original packaging shall be identified with the common name of the food. (114051) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Facilities that prepare food shall be equipped with a manual warewashing sink that has at least three compartments with two integral metal drainboards. A two compartment sink that was installed before January 1, 1996, need not be replaced when used in approved manner. Sink compartments shall be large enough to accommodate immersion of the largest equipment and utensils used. Testing materials shall be provided to adequately measure the applicable sanitization method used during manual or mechanical warewashing. (113984(e), 114067(f,g), 114099, 114099.3, 114099.5, 114101(a), 114101.1, 114101.2, 114103, 114107, 114125) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED

# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 43 RESTROOMS MAINTAINED, SUPPLIED, AND ACCESSIBLE
# 44e VERMIN AND ANIMAL EXCLUSION
# 46 LIVING AND SLEEPING QUARTERS

# 44e VERMIN AND ANIMAL EXCLUSION
# 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
A re-inspection is being conducted today to follow on routine inspection conducted on 10/31/15. No live vermin were noted at the facility. Several dead cockroaches and feces were noted as described under #23. Food temperatures in prep refrigerators were at/below 41F as documented in the temperature section of the report. The refrigerator was charged with freon. During the inspection it was discussed with operator that the facility must be vermin free to remain open. A re-inspection will be conducted within 7 days to follow up on compliance with violation number 23. Pest control reports were not available. Pest control company should be providing the operator with detailed sanitation and pest service reports.

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 8 TIME AS A PUBLIC HEALTH CONTROL
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 26 THAWING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Frozen foods shall be stored or displayed in their frozen state unless being thawed in the following manner: under refrigeration, completely submerged under cold running water with sufficient velocity to flush loose particles, in microwave oven, during the cooking process. (114018, 114020) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
CODE DESCRIPTION: Exhaust hoods shall be provided to remove toxic gases, heat, grease, vapors and smoke and be approved by health and building department. Canopy-type hoods shall extend six inches beyond all cooking equipment. All areas shall have sufficient ventilation to facilitate proper food storage. Toilet rooms shall be vented to the outside air by a screened openable window, air shaft, or light-switch activated exhaust fan. Adequate lighting shall be provided in all areas to facilitate cleaning and inspection. Light fixtures in areas where open food is stored, served, prepared, and where utensils are washed shall be of shatterproof construction or protected with light shields. (114149, 114149.1, 114149.2, 114149.3, 114252, 114252.1) # 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
# 44d EMPLOYEE PERSONAL ITEMS

# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 4 EATING, DRINKING, OR TOBACCO USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Employees shall not eat, drink, or use tobacco in any area where contamination of food, clean equipment and utensils, linens, and single use articles may occur. Employees may drink from closed beverage container if the container is handled to prevent contamination of the employee's hands, the container, nonprepackaged food, and food-contact surfaces. Area designated for employees to eat and drink shall be located so that food, clean equipment and utensils, linens, and single-use articles are protected from contamination. (113977, 114256 (a)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES

CODE DESCRIPTION: Containers holding food or food ingredients that are removed from their original packaging shall be identified with the common name of the food. (114051) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

# 43 RESTROOMS MAINTAINED, SUPPLIED, AND ACCESSIBLE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Toilet facilities shall be maintained and kept clean. Toilet rooms shall be separated by a well-fitting self-closing door. Toilet tissue shall be provided in a permanently installed dispenser at each toilet. The number of toilet facilities shall be in accordance with local building and plumbing ordinances. Toilet facilities shall be provided for patrons: in establishments with more than 20,000 sq. ft.; establishments offering on-site consumption of food. (114250, 114250.1, 114276) # 49 PERMIT REQUIREMENTS

# 14b WAREWASHING AND SANITIZING PROCEDURES
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 13 FOOD IN GOOD CONDITION, SAFE, AND UNADULTERATED
# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
CODE DESCRIPTION: Exhaust hoods shall be provided to remove toxic gases, heat, grease, vapors and smoke and be approved by health and building department. Canopy-type hoods shall extend six inches beyond all cooking equipment. All areas shall have sufficient ventilation to facilitate proper food storage. Toilet rooms shall be vented to the outside air by a screened openable window, air shaft, or light-switch activated exhaust fan. Adequate lighting shall be provided in all areas to facilitate cleaning and inspection. Light fixtures in areas where open food is stored, served, prepared, and where utensils are washed shall be of shatterproof construction or protected with light shields. (114149, 114149.1, 114149.2, 114149.3, 114252, 114252.1) # 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
# 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES
# 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
# 42 GARBAGE AND REFUSE DISPOSAL
# 44d EMPLOYEE PERSONAL ITEMS
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 4 EATING, DRINKING, OR TOBACCO USE
# 5a HANDWASHING PROCEDURES
OBSERVATIONS: Observed employee drink from coffee via straw while holding he straw with their hand near their mouth. Employee then proceeded to drink from their water bottle (see #4) and then go to counter to help customers without washing their hands first. Employee was asked to stop and wash their hands before they proceeded to touch food. Hands must be washed whenever contaminated, in between different tasks and/or prior to glove use. Review with employees immediately.
