o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
Facility Name: MCDONALD'S #47
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
Facility Name: MCDONALD'S #47
# 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES
CODE DESCRIPTION: An accurate easily readable metal probe thermometer suitable for measuring temperature of food shall be available to the food handler. Thermometers shall be calibrated in accordance with manufacturer's specifications as necessary to ensure their accuracy. A thermometer shall be provided for all refrigerators, hot and cold holding units, and high temperature warewashing machines. (114157, 114159) # 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
# 42 GARBAGE AND REFUSE DISPOSAL
# 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES

o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION

# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
# 4 EATING, DRINKING, OR TOBACCO USE
# 5a HANDWASHING PROCEDURES
# 5b BARE HAND CONTACT AND GLOVE USE
# 14b WAREWASHING AND SANITIZING PROCEDURES
# 24 PERSON IN CHARGE PRESENT AND PERFORMS DUTIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: A person in charge shall be present at the food facility during all hours of operation. Person in charge shall restrict unnecessary individuals from entering food prep areas and monitor self-service areas and food displays to prevent food and equipment contamination. (113945-113945.1, 113984.1, 114075) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE

o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Wiping cloths used to clean food and nonfood-contact surfaces shall be used only once unless kept in clean water with a sanitizer solution of 100 ppm available chlorine or 200 ppm quaternary ammonium. Sponges shall not be used on food-contact surfaces. Except for fabric implements, linen shall not be used in contact with food. (114099.6, 114135, 114185.1, 114185.3 (d-e)). # 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)

# 8 TIME AS A PUBLIC HEALTH CONTROL
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN OBSERVATIONS: -Observed old food residual and debris on the walls by the hand wash station and inoperable cold top unit and on the water heater below the three compartment sink.

# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS

# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION

# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING

# 4 EATING, DRINKING, OR TOBACCO USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Employees shall not eat, drink, or use tobacco in any area where contamination of food, clean equipment and utensils, linens, and single use articles may occur. Employees may drink from closed beverage container if the container is handled to prevent contamination of the employee's hands, the container, nonprepackaged food, and food-contact surfaces. Area designated for employees to eat and drink shall be located so that food, clean equipment and utensils, linens, and single-use articles are protected from contamination. (113977, 114256 (a)) # 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Steam tables, ice machines, ice bins, food preparation sinks, display cases, walk-in refrigeration units, and other similar equipment that discharge liquid waste shall drain into a floor sink with an air gap or other approved type of receptor. Plumbing and plumbing fixtures shall be maintained so as to prevent contamination, shall be kept clean, fully operative, and in good repair. The potable water supply shall be protected with a backflow or back siphonage protection device. Any hose used for potable water shall be of approved materials, labeled, properly stored, and used for no other purpose. (114171, 114190, 114192, 114193, 114193.1, 114199, 114201, 114269) # 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Containers holding food or food ingredients that are removed from their original packaging shall be identified with the common name of the food. (114051) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS

# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS OBSERVATIONS: BAR SERVER (OWNER) LACKING FOOD HANDLER CARD. 2ND REPEAT - PROVIDE WITHIN 30 DAYS
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES
# 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
# 44e VERMIN AND ANIMAL EXCLUSION
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Facilities that prepare food shall be equipped with a manual warewashing sink that has at least three compartments with two integral metal drainboards. A two compartment sink that was installed before January 1, 1996, need not be replaced when used in approved manner. Sink compartments shall be large enough to accommodate immersion of the largest equipment and utensils used. Testing materials shall be provided to adequately measure the applicable sanitization method used during manual or mechanical warewashing. (113984(e), 114067(f,g), 114099, 114099.3, 114099.5, 114101(a), 114101.1, 114101.2, 114103, 114107, 114125) # 44e VERMIN AND ANIMAL EXCLUSION
# 47a SIGNS POSTED AS REQUIRED

# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 4 EATING, DRINKING, OR TOBACCO USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Employees shall not eat, drink, or use tobacco in any area where contamination of food, clean equipment and utensils, linens, and single use articles may occur. Employees may drink from closed beverage container if the container is handled to prevent contamination of the employee's hands, the container, nonprepackaged food, and food-contact surfaces. Area designated for employees to eat and drink shall be located so that food, clean equipment and utensils, linens, and single-use articles are protected from contamination. (113977, 114256 (a)) # 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 14b WAREWASHING AND SANITIZING PROCEDURES
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Containers holding food or food ingredients that are removed from their original packaging shall be identified with the common name of the food. (114051) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Facilities that prepare food shall be equipped with a manual warewashing sink that has at least three compartments with two integral metal drainboards. A two compartment sink that was installed before January 1, 1996, need not be replaced when used in approved manner. Sink compartments shall be large enough to accommodate immersion of the largest equipment and utensils used. Testing materials shall be provided to adequately measure the applicable sanitization method used during manual or mechanical warewashing. (113984(e), 114067(f,g), 114099, 114099.3, 114099.5, 114101(a), 114101.1, 114101.2, 114103, 114107, 114125) # 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
CODE DESCRIPTION: Exhaust hoods shall be provided to remove toxic gases, heat, grease, vapors and smoke and be approved by health and building department. Canopy-type hoods shall extend six inches beyond all cooking equipment. All areas shall have sufficient ventilation to facilitate proper food storage. Toilet rooms shall be vented to the outside air by a screened openable window, air shaft, or light-switch activated exhaust fan. Adequate lighting shall be provided in all areas to facilitate cleaning and inspection. Light fixtures in areas where open food is stored, served, prepared, and where utensils are washed shall be of shatterproof construction or protected with light shields. (114149, 114149.1, 114149.2, 114149.3, 114252, 114252.1) # 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION

# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 44d EMPLOYEE PERSONAL ITEMS
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)

o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING

# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE

# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Wiping cloths used to clean food and nonfood-contact surfaces shall be used only once unless kept in clean water with a sanitizer solution of 100 ppm available chlorine or 200 ppm quaternary ammonium. Sponges shall not be used on food-contact surfaces. Except for fabric implements, linen shall not be used in contact with food. (114099.6, 114135, 114185.1, 114185.3 (d-e)). # 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
Facility Name: CARL'S JR RESTAURANT#8748

# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Facilities that prepare food shall be equipped with a manual warewashing sink that has at least three compartments with two integral metal drainboards. A two compartment sink that was installed before January 1, 1996, need not be replaced when used in approved manner. Sink compartments shall be large enough to accommodate immersion of the largest equipment and utensils used. Testing materials shall be provided to adequately measure the applicable sanitization method used during manual or mechanical warewashing. (113984(e), 114067(f,g), 114099, 114099.3, 114099.5, 114101(a), 114101.1, 114101.2, 114103, 114107, 114125) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED

# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 47c INSPECTION REPORT AVAILABILITY
Facility Name: ELLIOTT'S NATURAL FOODS #2
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 9 COOLING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be rapidly cooled from 135F to 70F within 2 hours, and then from 70F to 41F within 4 hours. Cooling shall be by one or more of the following methods: in shallow containers, separating food into smaller portions, adding ice as an ingredient, using an ice bath, stirring frequently, using rapid cooling equipment, or using containers that facilitate heat transfer. (114002, 114002.1) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES

Facility Name: CVS/ PHARMACY #9814
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 42 GARBAGE AND REFUSE DISPOSAL
# 43 RESTROOMS MAINTAINED, SUPPLIED, AND ACCESSIBLE

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 5a HANDWASHING PROCEDURES
# 9 COOLING METHODS
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Containers holding food or food ingredients that are removed from their original packaging shall be identified with the common name of the food. (114051) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Facilities that prepare food shall be equipped with a manual warewashing sink that has at least three compartments with two integral metal drainboards. A two compartment sink that was installed before January 1, 1996, need not be replaced when used in approved manner. Sink compartments shall be large enough to accommodate immersion of the largest equipment and utensils used. Testing materials shall be provided to adequately measure the applicable sanitization method used during manual or mechanical warewashing. (113984(e), 114067(f,g), 114099, 114099.3, 114099.5, 114101(a), 114101.1, 114101.2, 114103, 114107, 114125) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
# 44a PREMISES KEPT FREE OF UNUSED EQUIPMENT
A REINSPECTION MAYBE CONDUCTED WITHIN 7 DAYS TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH REPEAT VIOLATION #9 ON THIS REPORT.

Facility Name: CVS PHARMACY #9487
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 42 GARBAGE AND REFUSE DISPOSAL
CODE DESCRIPTION: The exterior premises of a food facility shall be kept free of litter and rubbish. All food waste and rubbish shall be kept in nonabsorbent, durable, cleanable, leak-proof, and rodent-proof containers. Containers shall have close-fitting lids and be covered at all times. All waste must be removed and disposed of as frequently as necessary to prevent the development of objectionable odors and other conditions that attract or harbor insects or rodents. (114244, 114245, 114245.1, 114245.2, 114245.3, 114245.4, 114245.5, 114245.6, 114245.7, 114257) # 43 RESTROOMS MAINTAINED, SUPPLIED, AND ACCESSIBLE
OBSERVATIONS: LACK OF TOILET PAPER IN STALL #2 IN WOMEM'S RESTROOM. PROVIDE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Toilet facilities shall be maintained and kept clean. Toilet rooms shall be separated by a well-fitting self-closing door. Toilet tissue shall be provided in a permanently installed dispenser at each toilet. The number of toilet facilities shall be in accordance with local building and plumbing ordinances. Toilet facilities shall be provided for patrons: in establishments with more than 20,000 sq. ft.; establishments offering on-site consumption of food. (114250, 114250.1, 114276) # 47c INSPECTION REPORT AVAILABILITY

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS

CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 9 COOLING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be rapidly cooled from 135F to 70F within 2 hours, and then from 70F to 41F within 4 hours. Cooling shall be by one or more of the following methods: in shallow containers, separating food into smaller portions, adding ice as an ingredient, using an ice bath, stirring frequently, using rapid cooling equipment, or using containers that facilitate heat transfer. (114002, 114002.1) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION

CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES

Facility Name: BURGER KING #5085
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Facilities that prepare food shall be equipped with a manual warewashing sink that has at least three compartments with two integral metal drainboards. A two compartment sink that was installed before January 1, 1996, need not be replaced when used in approved manner. Sink compartments shall be large enough to accommodate immersion of the largest equipment and utensils used. Testing materials shall be provided to adequately measure the applicable sanitization method used during manual or mechanical warewashing. (113984(e), 114067(f,g), 114099, 114099.3, 114099.5, 114101(a), 114101.1, 114101.2, 114103, 114107, 114125) # 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
Facility Name: QUICK TRIP MART #1

o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 32a FOOD PRESENTATION AND LABELING
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food offered for human consumption shall be honestly presented in a way that does not mislead or misinform the consumer. Food packaged in a food facility shall bear a label that complies with the labeling requirements prescribed by the Sherman Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Law which include: common name of the food, ingredients list, quantity of contents, name and address of manufacturer, nutritional information as specified in 21 C.F.R. (114087, 114088, 114089, 114089.1(a, b), 114090, 114093.1) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Wiping cloths used to clean food and nonfood-contact surfaces shall be used only once unless kept in clean water with a sanitizer solution of 100 ppm available chlorine or 200 ppm quaternary ammonium. Sponges shall not be used on food-contact surfaces. Except for fabric implements, linen shall not be used in contact with food. (114099.6, 114135, 114185.1, 114185.3 (d-e)). # 44c MOP SINK AND JANITORIAL AREA

# 44a PREMISES KEPT FREE OF UNUSED EQUIPMENT
CODE DESCRIPTION: The premises of a food facility shall be kept free of items that are unnecessary to the operation or maintenance of the facility, such as equipment that is nonfunctional or no longer used. (114257.1.) # 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES OBSERVATIONS: Observed gap between cove base and wall located under 3 compartment sink.

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 9 COOLING METHODS
OBSERVATIONS: Observed cooked chowmein noodles (157F), cooked bean sprouts (59F) and cooked spinach (53F) cooked within the previous 40 minutes improperly cooling inside cold-top inserts. Do not use cold-top unit for cooling as it will increase the temperature of other potentially hazardous foods (see #7). Items were relocated to ice baths.

# 42 GARBAGE AND REFUSE DISPOSAL
# 44c MOP SINK AND JANITORIAL AREA
CODE DESCRIPTION: At least one janitorial sink equipped with hot and cold water and a drain shall be provided and conveniently located for the cleaning of mops or similar wet floor cleaning tools and for the disposal of mop water and similar liquid waste. A room, area, or cabinet separated from food preparation, food storage, or warewashing shall be provided for the storage of cleaning equipment and supplies. After use, mops shall be placed in a position that allows them to air-dry without soiling walls, equipment, or supplies. (114279, 114281, 114282) # 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES

# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 9 COOLING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be rapidly cooled from 135F to 70F within 2 hours, and then from 70F to 41F within 4 hours. Cooling shall be by one or more of the following methods: in shallow containers, separating food into smaller portions, adding ice as an ingredient, using an ice bath, stirring frequently, using rapid cooling equipment, or using containers that facilitate heat transfer. (114002, 114002.1) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

Facility Name: BURGER KING #9252
# 8 TIME AS A PUBLIC HEALTH CONTROL
CODE DESCRIPTION: When time as a public health control is used, the following procedures shall be observed: food items shall be marked to indicate four hours past the time when the food was removed from temperature control, food shall be served or discarded within the four-hour time limit, written procedures for food that was prepared, cooked, and refrigerated before time as a public health control was used, shall be maintained at the food facility and be made available to the enforcement agency upon request. (114000) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED

CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. # 14b WAREWASHING AND SANITIZING PROCEDURES
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
CODE DESCRIPTION: Exhaust hoods shall be provided to remove toxic gases, heat, grease, vapors and smoke and be approved by health and building department. Canopy-type hoods shall extend six inches beyond all cooking equipment. All areas shall have sufficient ventilation to facilitate proper food storage. Toilet rooms shall be vented to the outside air by a screened openable window, air shaft, or light-switch activated exhaust fan. Adequate lighting shall be provided in all areas to facilitate cleaning and inspection. Light fixtures in areas where open food is stored, served, prepared, and where utensils are washed shall be of shatterproof construction or protected with light shields. (114149, 114149.1, 114149.2, 114149.3, 114252, 114252.1) # 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
# 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
# 44d EMPLOYEE PERSONAL ITEMS
# 44e VERMIN AND ANIMAL EXCLUSION
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
Reinspection conducted as a result of Yellow Placard issued to facility for major violations #6 and #7 (see inspection report dated 12/18/15). Spoke with the facility Executive Su Chef Steve Gonsalves and he is aware of the violations. At time of inspection, all hand wash sinks are stocked with paper towels and soap. All soap dispensers are functioning properly. At time of inspection whipped butter measured at 41F in cold top refrigerator. Steve states that going forward the whipped butter will not be kept in ice on cook's line and will be store inside cold top refrigerator across from cook's line.

# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 22 SEWAGE AND WASTEWATER DISPOSAL
# 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
# 44d EMPLOYEE PERSONAL ITEMS
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 8 TIME AS A PUBLIC HEALTH CONTROL
CODE DESCRIPTION: When time as a public health control is used, the following procedures shall be observed: food items shall be marked to indicate four hours past the time when the food was removed from temperature control, food shall be served or discarded within the four-hour time limit, written procedures for food that was prepared, cooked, and refrigerated before time as a public health control was used, shall be maintained at the food facility and be made available to the enforcement agency upon request. (114000) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED

# 5a HANDWASHING PROCEDURES

# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
Facility Name: 7-ELEVEN #2365-35481A
# 44d EMPLOYEE PERSONAL ITEMS
CODE DESCRIPTION: No person shall store clothing or personal effects in any area used for the storage and preparation of food. Lockers or other suitable facilities shall be provided and used for the orderly storage of employee clothing and other possessions. Lockers or other suitable facilities shall be located in a designated room or area where contamination of food, equipment, utensils, and single-use articles cannot occur. (114256, 114256.1.) # 47a SIGNS POSTED AS REQUIRED
# 47c INSPECTION REPORT AVAILABILITY
Facility Name: 7-ELEVEN #2365-35481A

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 14b WAREWASHING AND SANITIZING PROCEDURES
# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
# 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Containers holding food or food ingredients that are removed from their original packaging shall be identified with the common name of the food. (114051) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
# 43 RESTROOMS MAINTAINED, SUPPLIED, AND ACCESSIBLE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Toilet facilities shall be maintained and kept clean. Toilet rooms shall be separated by a well-fitting self-closing door. Toilet tissue shall be provided in a permanently installed dispenser at each toilet. The number of toilet facilities shall be in accordance with local building and plumbing ordinances. Toilet facilities shall be provided for patrons: in establishments with more than 20,000 sq. ft.; establishments offering on-site consumption of food. (114250, 114250.1, 114276) # 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
# 47a SIGNS POSTED AS REQUIRED
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 31 CONSUMER SELF-SERVICE OPERATIONS
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Clean equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Clean equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin or other forms of contamination. Non-food items shall be stored and displayed separate from food and food-contact surfaces. During pauses in food preparation utensils shall be stored with handles above the top of the food, on a clean sanitized surface, in running water, or in water that is at least 135F. Single-use articles and multiservice utensils shall be handled, displayed, and dispensed so that contamination of food and lip-contact surfaces is prevented. Pressurized cylinders shall be securely fastened to rigid structure. (114074, 114081, 114119, 114121, 114161, 114172, 114178, 114179, 114083, 114185, 114185.2, 114185.3, 114185.4, 114185.5) # 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)

Facility Name: NOAH'S NEW YORK BAGELS #2181
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. # 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Facilities that prepare food shall be equipped with a manual warewashing sink that has at least three compartments with two integral metal drainboards. A two compartment sink that was installed before January 1, 1996, need not be replaced when used in approved manner. Sink compartments shall be large enough to accommodate immersion of the largest equipment and utensils used. Testing materials shall be provided to adequately measure the applicable sanitization method used during manual or mechanical warewashing. (113984(e), 114067(f,g), 114099, 114099.3, 114099.5, 114101(a), 114101.1, 114101.2, 114103, 114107, 114125) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
# 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
# 44a PREMISES KEPT FREE OF UNUSED EQUIPMENT
CODE DESCRIPTION: The premises of a food facility shall be kept free of items that are unnecessary to the operation or maintenance of the facility, such as equipment that is nonfunctional or no longer used. (114257.1.) # 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
MINOR VIOLATION The following items were out of proper holding temperature: *styrofoam boxes filled with fish, on floor near water heater, measured 47F. * egg loaf, in sushi case #1, measured 44F *white fish, in sushi case #1, measured 44F *raw shrimp, in cold top insert, measured 48F *raw fish, on top of cold top insert, measured 44F *salmon, walk in cooler, measured 44F Correct immediately. # 8 TIME AS A PUBLIC HEALTH CONTROL
# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Wiping cloths used to clean food and nonfood-contact surfaces shall be used only once unless kept in clean water with a sanitizer solution of 100 ppm available chlorine or 200 ppm quaternary ammonium. Sponges shall not be used on food-contact surfaces. Except for fabric implements, linen shall not be used in contact with food. (114099.6, 114135, 114185.1, 114185.3 (d-e)). # 44e VERMIN AND ANIMAL EXCLUSION
# 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES

# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
# 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
# 43 RESTROOMS MAINTAINED, SUPPLIED, AND ACCESSIBLE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Toilet facilities shall be maintained and kept clean. Toilet rooms shall be separated by a well-fitting self-closing door. Toilet tissue shall be provided in a permanently installed dispenser at each toilet. The number of toilet facilities shall be in accordance with local building and plumbing ordinances. Toilet facilities shall be provided for patrons: in establishments with more than 20,000 sq. ft.; establishments offering on-site consumption of food. (114250, 114250.1, 114276) # 44e VERMIN AND ANIMAL EXCLUSION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be constructed, equipped, and maintained as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to, rodents and insects. Doors opening to outside air shall have a self-closing device and have no gaps greater than 1/4 inch when closed. Insect control devices shall be installed so that the devices are not located over a food or utensil handling areas. Pass-thru windows shall be of an approved size and be equipped with a self-closing device and air curtain if required. (114259, 114259.2, 114259.3) # 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
x Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Containers holding food or food ingredients that are removed from their original packaging shall be identified with the common name of the food. (114051) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Facilities that prepare food shall be equipped with a manual warewashing sink that has at least three compartments with two integral metal drainboards. A two compartment sink that was installed before January 1, 1996, need not be replaced when used in approved manner. Sink compartments shall be large enough to accommodate immersion of the largest equipment and utensils used. Testing materials shall be provided to adequately measure the applicable sanitization method used during manual or mechanical warewashing. (113984(e), 114067(f,g), 114099, 114099.3, 114099.5, 114101(a), 114101.1, 114101.2, 114103, 114107, 114125) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 44a PREMISES KEPT FREE OF UNUSED EQUIPMENT
# 47c INSPECTION REPORT AVAILABILITY
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 13 FOOD IN GOOD CONDITION, SAFE, AND UNADULTERATED
# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION

Facility Name: SUBWAY SANDWICHES #5775
# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
# 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
# 44b APPROPRIATE USE OF EQUIPMENT
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES

# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
OBSERVATIONS: Unsecured CO2 tanks in Bar #9. Secure all pressurized tanks to rigid structure. Correct within 3 days.
# 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
OBSERVATIONS: Plumbing in floor sink of in Video bar and Bar #9. Maintain plumbing 1 inch above rim of floor sink. Correct within 7 days.

# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION

# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 5a HANDWASHING PROCEDURES
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 9 COOLING METHODS
# 16 SHELLSTOCK IDENTIFICATION TAGS
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 28 WASHING FRUITS AND VEGETABLES OBSERVATIONS: Observed employee cutting potatoes with french fry press from bag without washing the potatoes first. REPEAT VIOLATION. Employee asked to stop and wash the potatoes. Review with all employees.
CODE DESCRIPTION: Produce shall be thoroughly washed in potable water to remove soil and other contaminants before being cut, combined with other ingredients, cooked, served, or offered for human consumption. (113992) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN OBSERVATIONS: Unclean hood filters at cook's line. REPEAT VIOLATION. Clean within 3 days.

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

The dish washer at the bar station is dispensing 50 ppm chlorine.

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED

# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. # 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES

Facility Name: SMASHBURGER #1158
# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 42 GARBAGE AND REFUSE DISPOSAL

# 1a DEMONSTRATION OF KNOWLEDGE
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
OBSERVATIONS: MILK STORED IN MILK REFRIGERATOR #8, MEASURED AT 51 DEGREES F. MILK WAS DELIVERED TODAY AT 8AM. MILK HELD FOR 1 HOUR AND STILL WITHIN THE 4 HOUR COLD HOLDING TIME FRAME. STAFF MOVED MILK AND OTHER REMAINING POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS FOODS TO ANOTHER REFRIGERATOR. SEE ITEM #35.
# 9 COOLING METHODS
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
OBSERVATIONS: MILK REFRIGERATOR #8 AMBIENT TEMPERATURE MEASURED AT 50 DEGREES F. THIS UNIT UNABLE TO MAINTAIN FOOD TEMPERATURES AT 41 DEGREES F AND BELOW. ADJUST/REPAIR REFRIGERATOR THERMOSTAT. CORRECT WITHIN 24 HOURS. SEND PROOF OF CORRECTION TO INSPECTOR BY FAX OR EMAIL .

# 13 FOOD IN GOOD CONDITION, SAFE, AND UNADULTERATED
