# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
Facility Name: ARCO AM PM #83080
# 1a DEMONSTRATION OF KNOWLEDGE
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES
Facility Name: ARCO AM PM #83080
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
Facility Name: ARCO AM/PM #82821
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN OBSERVATIONS: Speed rack next to DeLuxe oven unclean. Clean today.

o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 9 COOLING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be rapidly cooled from 135F to 70F within 2 hours, and then from 70F to 41F within 4 hours. Cooling shall be by one or more of the following methods: in shallow containers, separating food into smaller portions, adding ice as an ingredient, using an ice bath, stirring frequently, using rapid cooling equipment, or using containers that facilitate heat transfer. (114002, 114002.1) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE

# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES

# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 4 EATING, DRINKING, OR TOBACCO USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Employees shall not eat, drink, or use tobacco in any area where contamination of food, clean equipment and utensils, linens, and single use articles may occur. Employees may drink from closed beverage container if the container is handled to prevent contamination of the employee's hands, the container, nonprepackaged food, and food-contact surfaces. Area designated for employees to eat and drink shall be located so that food, clean equipment and utensils, linens, and single-use articles are protected from contamination. (113977, 114256 (a)) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 4 EATING, DRINKING, OR TOBACCO USE
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED

# 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Facilities that prepare food shall be equipped with a manual warewashing sink that has at least three compartments with two integral metal drainboards. A two compartment sink that was installed before January 1, 1996, need not be replaced when used in approved manner. Sink compartments shall be large enough to accommodate immersion of the largest equipment and utensils used. Testing materials shall be provided to adequately measure the applicable sanitization method used during manual or mechanical warewashing. (113984(e), 114067(f,g), 114099, 114099.3, 114099.5, 114101(a), 114101.1, 114101.2, 114103, 114107, 114125) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
# 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION

# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED OBSERVATIONS: Domestic grade coffee maker observed in the front area. Remove this item within 30 days. All equipment must be commercial grade and bear an NSF or equivalent decal. Correct immediately.
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)

Facility Name: TOWER MART #130
# 1a DEMONSTRATION OF KNOWLEDGE
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 47c INSPECTION REPORT AVAILABILITY

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED
# 32a FOOD PRESENTATION AND LABELING

Facility Name: PANDA EXPRESS #1048
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
# 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
Facility Name: PANDA EXPRESS #1048

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION OBSERVATIONS: Approx 3 flies noted in prep areas. Eliminate flies on a daily basis. Correct 1 day.

# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS OBSERVATIONS: One food handler card is expired. Provide current food handler card within 30 days.

# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION

# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Wiping cloths used to clean food and nonfood-contact surfaces shall be used only once unless kept in clean water with a sanitizer solution of 100 ppm available chlorine or 200 ppm quaternary ammonium. Sponges shall not be used on food-contact surfaces. Except for fabric implements, linen shall not be used in contact with food. (114099.6, 114135, 114185.1, 114185.3 (d-e)). # 44d EMPLOYEE PERSONAL ITEMS

o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 1a DEMONSTRATION OF KNOWLEDGE
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
# 32a FOOD PRESENTATION AND LABELING
# 32b COMPLIANCE WITH TRANS FAT BAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: No food containing artificial trans fat may be stored, distributed, served by, or used in the preparation of any food within a food facility. Every food facility shall maintain on the premises, the label for any food that contains fat, oil, or shortening, for as long as this food is stored, distributed, served by, or used in the preparation of food within the food facility. Food sold or served in a manufacturer's original sealed package is exempt from this requirement. (114377) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Facilities that prepare food shall be equipped with a manual warewashing sink that has at least three compartments with two integral metal drainboards. A two compartment sink that was installed before January 1, 1996, need not be replaced when used in approved manner. Sink compartments shall be large enough to accommodate immersion of the largest equipment and utensils used. Testing materials shall be provided to adequately measure the applicable sanitization method used during manual or mechanical warewashing. (113984(e), 114067(f,g), 114099, 114099.3, 114099.5, 114101(a), 114101.1, 114101.2, 114103, 114107, 114125) # 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES
# 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION

o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 32b COMPLIANCE WITH TRANS FAT BAN

# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES

o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 8 TIME AS A PUBLIC HEALTH CONTROL
CODE DESCRIPTION: When time as a public health control is used, the following procedures shall be observed: food items shall be marked to indicate four hours past the time when the food was removed from temperature control, food shall be served or discarded within the four-hour time limit, written procedures for food that was prepared, cooked, and refrigerated before time as a public health control was used, shall be maintained at the food facility and be made available to the enforcement agency upon request. (114000) # 1a DEMONSTRATION OF KNOWLEDGE

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

# 44d EMPLOYEE PERSONAL ITEMS
# 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES

Facility Name: TACO BELL #31118
# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. # 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES

# 8 TIME AS A PUBLIC HEALTH CONTROL
CODE DESCRIPTION: When time as a public health control is used, the following procedures shall be observed: food items shall be marked to indicate four hours past the time when the food was removed from temperature control, food shall be served or discarded within the four-hour time limit, written procedures for food that was prepared, cooked, and refrigerated before time as a public health control was used, shall be maintained at the food facility and be made available to the enforcement agency upon request. (114000) # 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES

# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. # 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 44a PREMISES KEPT FREE OF UNUSED EQUIPMENT
CODE DESCRIPTION: The premises of a food facility shall be kept free of items that are unnecessary to the operation or maintenance of the facility, such as equipment that is nonfunctional or no longer used. (114257.1.) # 44d EMPLOYEE PERSONAL ITEMS
# 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)

# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 32a FOOD PRESENTATION AND LABELING
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food offered for human consumption shall be honestly presented in a way that does not mislead or misinform the consumer. Food packaged in a food facility shall bear a label that complies with the labeling requirements prescribed by the Sherman Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Law which include: common name of the food, ingredients list, quantity of contents, name and address of manufacturer, nutritional information as specified in 21 C.F.R. (114087, 114088, 114089, 114089.1(a, b), 114090, 114093.1) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)

Facility Name: DOLLAR TREE #3566
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 43 RESTROOMS MAINTAINED, SUPPLIED, AND ACCESSIBLE

Facility Name: STARBUCKS COFFEE #8827
# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 26 THAWING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Frozen foods shall be stored or displayed in their frozen state unless being thawed in the following manner: under refrigeration, completely submerged under cold running water with sufficient velocity to flush loose particles, in microwave oven, during the cooking process. (114018, 114020) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
# 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION

# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 9 COOLING METHODS
# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Wiping cloths used to clean food and nonfood-contact surfaces shall be used only once unless kept in clean water with a sanitizer solution of 100 ppm available chlorine or 200 ppm quaternary ammonium. Sponges shall not be used on food-contact surfaces. Except for fabric implements, linen shall not be used in contact with food. (114099.6, 114135, 114185.1, 114185.3 (d-e)). # 47c INSPECTION REPORT AVAILABILITY

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Facilities that prepare food shall be equipped with a manual warewashing sink that has at least three compartments with two integral metal drainboards. A two compartment sink that was installed before January 1, 1996, need not be replaced when used in approved manner. Sink compartments shall be large enough to accommodate immersion of the largest equipment and utensils used. Testing materials shall be provided to adequately measure the applicable sanitization method used during manual or mechanical warewashing. (113984(e), 114067(f,g), 114099, 114099.3, 114099.5, 114101(a), 114101.1, 114101.2, 114103, 114107, 114125) # 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
# 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
# 43 RESTROOMS MAINTAINED, SUPPLIED, AND ACCESSIBLE
# 44a PREMISES KEPT FREE OF UNUSED EQUIPMENT
CODE DESCRIPTION: The premises of a food facility shall be kept free of items that are unnecessary to the operation or maintenance of the facility, such as equipment that is nonfunctional or no longer used. (114257.1.) # 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES

# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Containers holding food or food ingredients that are removed from their original packaging shall be identified with the common name of the food. (114051) # 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
# 42 GARBAGE AND REFUSE DISPOSAL
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)

Facility Name: ARCO AM/PM #6019
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 1a DEMONSTRATION OF KNOWLEDGE
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS
Facility Name: ARCO AM/PM #6019

# 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
# 44c MOP SINK AND JANITORIAL AREA
CODE DESCRIPTION: At least one janitorial sink equipped with hot and cold water and a drain shall be provided and conveniently located for the cleaning of mops or similar wet floor cleaning tools and for the disposal of mop water and similar liquid waste. A room, area, or cabinet separated from food preparation, food storage, or warewashing shall be provided for the storage of cleaning equipment and supplies. After use, mops shall be placed in a position that allows them to air-dry without soiling walls, equipment, or supplies. (114279, 114281, 114282) # 47a SIGNS POSTED AS REQUIRED
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)

# 8 TIME AS A PUBLIC HEALTH CONTROL
CODE DESCRIPTION: When time as a public health control is used, the following procedures shall be observed: food items shall be marked to indicate four hours past the time when the food was removed from temperature control, food shall be served or discarded within the four-hour time limit, written procedures for food that was prepared, cooked, and refrigerated before time as a public health control was used, shall be maintained at the food facility and be made available to the enforcement agency upon request. (114000) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED

# 8 TIME AS A PUBLIC HEALTH CONTROL
CODE DESCRIPTION: When time as a public health control is used, the following procedures shall be observed: food items shall be marked to indicate four hours past the time when the food was removed from temperature control, food shall be served or discarded within the four-hour time limit, written procedures for food that was prepared, cooked, and refrigerated before time as a public health control was used, shall be maintained at the food facility and be made available to the enforcement agency upon request. (114000) # 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

# 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES
Facility Name: ARCO AM/PM #5424
Reinspection conducted as a result of Yellow Placard issued to facility for major violations #6 and #7 (see inspection report dated 12/17/15). Spoke with the facility cashier Tahir Uddi and he is aware of the violations. At time of inspection hand wash station is accessible and is stocked with paper towels and soap. At time of inspection half and half was not in cold top cooler, no cut tomatoes were available in cold top, and no sandwiches at open air cooler. Cashier stated that cut tomatoes ran out and owner have not purchased yet. Tahir stated that owner is aware of refrigeration not holding temperature at 41F or below and is working to get it repaired. In the mean time, employees are informed not to store potential hazardous food items at open air cooler.

CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. CODE DESCRIPTION: Liquid waste shall be disposed of through the approved plumbing system that discharges into the public sewerage or into an approved private sewage disposal system. Grease traps and grease interceptors shall be easily accessible for servicing. (114197, 114201) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

Facility Name: SHELL FACILITY #135794
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 44e VERMIN AND ANIMAL EXCLUSION
Facility Name: SHELL FACILITY #135794

# 43 RESTROOMS MAINTAINED, SUPPLIED, AND ACCESSIBLE
# 44a PREMISES KEPT FREE OF UNUSED EQUIPMENT
CODE DESCRIPTION: The premises of a food facility shall be kept free of items that are unnecessary to the operation or maintenance of the facility, such as equipment that is nonfunctional or no longer used. (114257.1.) # 47c INSPECTION REPORT AVAILABILITY OBSERVATIONS: Last inspection report is not available. Correct today.

# 1a DEMONSTRATION OF KNOWLEDGE
# 9 COOLING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be rapidly cooled from 135F to 70F within 2 hours, and then from 70F to 41F within 4 hours. Cooling shall be by one or more of the following methods: in shallow containers, separating food into smaller portions, adding ice as an ingredient, using an ice bath, stirring frequently, using rapid cooling equipment, or using containers that facilitate heat transfer. (114002, 114002.1) # 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS

# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
# 32a FOOD PRESENTATION AND LABELING
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food offered for human consumption shall be honestly presented in a way that does not mislead or misinform the consumer. Food packaged in a food facility shall bear a label that complies with the labeling requirements prescribed by the Sherman Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Law which include: common name of the food, ingredients list, quantity of contents, name and address of manufacturer, nutritional information as specified in 21 C.F.R. (114087, 114088, 114089, 114089.1(a, b), 114090, 114093.1) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 47c INSPECTION REPORT AVAILABILITY
Facility Name: QUAIL POINT CHEVRON #93540

# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS

Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. # 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING

# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
CODE DESCRIPTION: Exhaust hoods shall be provided to remove toxic gases, heat, grease, vapors and smoke and be approved by health and building department. Canopy-type hoods shall extend six inches beyond all cooking equipment. All areas shall have sufficient ventilation to facilitate proper food storage. Toilet rooms shall be vented to the outside air by a screened openable window, air shaft, or light-switch activated exhaust fan. Adequate lighting shall be provided in all areas to facilitate cleaning and inspection. Light fixtures in areas where open food is stored, served, prepared, and where utensils are washed shall be of shatterproof construction or protected with light shields. (114149, 114149.1, 114149.2, 114149.3, 114252, 114252.1) # 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES

# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
OBSERVATIONS: Dipper well and yogurt machine (clear pipe) directly connected into sewage drain located beneath front handwash sink. Also, shaved ice drainage tube found inside front handwash sink. Provide proper indirect drainage for dipper well, yogurt machine, and ice shaver within 5 days. Provide plans for drainage to EMD Plan Review for approval. (Also, see violation #48) REPEAT VIOLATION Note: Existing floor sink located about 28 feet away from dipper well.

# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED OBSERVATIONS: Observed pink slime like build up on panel of ice machine. Clean, rinse, and sanitize within 24 hours.
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN OBSERVATIONS: Observed food debris inside refrigerators. Clean and sanitize within 48 hours.
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED

# 31 CONSUMER SELF-SERVICE OPERATIONS
# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Wiping cloths used to clean food and nonfood-contact surfaces shall be used only once unless kept in clean water with a sanitizer solution of 100 ppm available chlorine or 200 ppm quaternary ammonium. Sponges shall not be used on food-contact surfaces. Except for fabric implements, linen shall not be used in contact with food. (114099.6, 114135, 114185.1, 114185.3 (d-e)). # 49 PERMIT REQUIREMENTS

# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS

# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
# 4 EATING, DRINKING, OR TOBACCO USE
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN OBSERVATIONS: Heavy grease accumulation on floor under fryers, around wheels of fryer, and the sides of the fryers. Clean and maintain within 7 days
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 44e VERMIN AND ANIMAL EXCLUSION
# 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

# 4 EATING, DRINKING, OR TOBACCO USE
# 5a HANDWASHING PROCEDURES
# 9 COOLING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be rapidly cooled from 135F to 70F within 2 hours, and then from 70F to 41F within 4 hours. Cooling shall be by one or more of the following methods: in shallow containers, separating food into smaller portions, adding ice as an ingredient, using an ice bath, stirring frequently, using rapid cooling equipment, or using containers that facilitate heat transfer. (114002, 114002.1) # 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
# 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES

# 9 COOLING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be rapidly cooled from 135F to 70F within 2 hours, and then from 70F to 41F within 4 hours. Cooling shall be by one or more of the following methods: in shallow containers, separating food into smaller portions, adding ice as an ingredient, using an ice bath, stirring frequently, using rapid cooling equipment, or using containers that facilitate heat transfer. (114002, 114002.1) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. # 14b WAREWASHING AND SANITIZING PROCEDURES
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
# 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED

# 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
# 44a PREMISES KEPT FREE OF UNUSED EQUIPMENT
CODE DESCRIPTION: The premises of a food facility shall be kept free of items that are unnecessary to the operation or maintenance of the facility, such as equipment that is nonfunctional or no longer used. (114257.1.) # 49 PERMIT REQUIREMENTS
x Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)

# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES

# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 4 EATING, DRINKING, OR TOBACCO USE OBSERVATIONS: Observed bartender use electronic cigarette while working behind bar. Corrected. Education provided.

# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Wiping cloths used to clean food and nonfood-contact surfaces shall be used only once unless kept in clean water with a sanitizer solution of 100 ppm available chlorine or 200 ppm quaternary ammonium. Sponges shall not be used on food-contact surfaces. Except for fabric implements, linen shall not be used in contact with food. (114099.6, 114135, 114185.1, 114185.3 (d-e)). # 43 RESTROOMS MAINTAINED, SUPPLIED, AND ACCESSIBLE

# 5a HANDWASHING PROCEDURES
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION

o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
Facility Name: TOLEDO'S MEXICAN MARKET #2
# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 9 COOLING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be rapidly cooled from 135F to 70F within 2 hours, and then from 70F to 41F within 4 hours. Cooling shall be by one or more of the following methods: in shallow containers, separating food into smaller portions, adding ice as an ingredient, using an ice bath, stirring frequently, using rapid cooling equipment, or using containers that facilitate heat transfer. (114002, 114002.1) # 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 32a FOOD PRESENTATION AND LABELING
Facility Name: TOLEDO'S MEXICAN MARKET #2
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 44d EMPLOYEE PERSONAL ITEMS
Facility Name: TOLEDO'S MEXICAN MARKET #2

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
# 42 GARBAGE AND REFUSE DISPOSAL
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)

OBSERVATIONS: Improper food storage is observed as follow: -raw shrimp above pasta noodles inside 3-door reach-in cooler #1 -raw fish fillet, chicken, and shrimp stored above cooked potato and chicken inside walk-in refrigerator
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Containers holding food or food ingredients that are removed from their original packaging shall be identified with the common name of the food. (114051) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN OBSERVATIONS: Heavy grease build-up is observed on floor behind fryer. Clean and maintain within 7 days.

# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION

# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 42 GARBAGE AND REFUSE DISPOSAL
# 43 RESTROOMS MAINTAINED, SUPPLIED, AND ACCESSIBLE
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED

# 26 THAWING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Frozen foods shall be stored or displayed in their frozen state unless being thawed in the following manner: under refrigeration, completely submerged under cold running water with sufficient velocity to flush loose particles, in microwave oven, during the cooking process. (114018, 114020) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 32a FOOD PRESENTATION AND LABELING
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food offered for human consumption shall be honestly presented in a way that does not mislead or misinform the consumer. Food packaged in a food facility shall bear a label that complies with the labeling requirements prescribed by the Sherman Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Law which include: common name of the food, ingredients list, quantity of contents, name and address of manufacturer, nutritional information as specified in 21 C.F.R. (114087, 114088, 114089, 114089.1(a, b), 114090, 114093.1) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
OBSERVATIONS: Approximately 10-15 rodent droppings observed on the floor in snack bar #1. They are located on the floor behind the sliding door two door and one door refrigeration units. There is not a monthly pest control service. They are called when needed. Maintenance is aware of the situation and have been placing glue traps. Recommend having a pest control service come on a monthly basis. Remove droppings and monitor for new activity.
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
OBSERVATIONS: Dust on fan guard inside sliding door refrigerator in snack bar #2. Clean and maintain within 2 days.

# 1a DEMONSTRATION OF KNOWLEDGE
# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS
# 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION

# 9 COOLING METHODS
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED

# 8 TIME AS A PUBLIC HEALTH CONTROL
CODE DESCRIPTION: When time as a public health control is used, the following procedures shall be observed: food items shall be marked to indicate four hours past the time when the food was removed from temperature control, food shall be served or discarded within the four-hour time limit, written procedures for food that was prepared, cooked, and refrigerated before time as a public health control was used, shall be maintained at the food facility and be made available to the enforcement agency upon request. (114000) # 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
