# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 47b PLACARD POSTED IN APPROVED LOCATION
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
Facility Name: PANDA EXPRESS #1774
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 24 PERSON IN CHARGE PRESENT AND PERFORMS DUTIES
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
Facility Name: PANDA EXPRESS #1774

# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
Facility Name: ARCO AM/PM #82450
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
CODE DESCRIPTION: Exhaust hoods shall be provided to remove toxic gases, heat, grease, vapors and smoke and be approved by health and building department. Canopy-type hoods shall extend six inches beyond all cooking equipment. All areas shall have sufficient ventilation to facilitate proper food storage. Toilet rooms shall be vented to the outside air by a screened openable window, air shaft, or light-switch activated exhaust fan. Adequate lighting shall be provided in all areas to facilitate cleaning and inspection. Light fixtures in areas where open food is stored, served, prepared, and where utensils are washed shall be of shatterproof construction or protected with light shields. (114149, 114149.1, 114149.2, 114149.3, 114252, 114252.1) # 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
Facility Name: ARCO AM/PM #82450
# 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
# 44c MOP SINK AND JANITORIAL AREA
Facility Name: ARCO AM/PM #82450

# 9 COOLING METHODS
# 1a DEMONSTRATION OF KNOWLEDGE
# 4 EATING, DRINKING, OR TOBACCO USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Employees shall not eat, drink, or use tobacco in any area where contamination of food, clean equipment and utensils, linens, and single use articles may occur. Employees may drink from closed beverage container if the container is handled to prevent contamination of the employee's hands, the container, nonprepackaged food, and food-contact surfaces. Area designated for employees to eat and drink shall be located so that food, clean equipment and utensils, linens, and single-use articles are protected from contamination. (113977, 114256 (a)) # 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES

# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
# 44c MOP SINK AND JANITORIAL AREA
# 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities shall be fully enclosed in a building consisting of permanent floors, walls, and an overhead structure that meets minimum standards. The walls and ceiling shall be smooth, durable, nonabsorbent, and easily cleanable. Flooring and base coving shall be smooth, durable, and made of approved nonabsorbent material that is easily cleanable. Floor surfaces shall be coved at the juncture of the floor and wall with a 3/8 inch minimum radius and shall extend up the wall at least 4 inches. (114143 (d), 114266, 114268, 114268.1, 114271, 114272) # 50 IMPOUNDMENT OF FOOD, UTENSILS, AND EQUIPMENT

CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS
# 42 GARBAGE AND REFUSE DISPOSAL

# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE

# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION OBSERVATIONS: Carton of ice cream and bag of ice are stored directly on the floor inside the walk-in freezer. Corrected on-site.

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 4 EATING, DRINKING, OR TOBACCO USE
# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 32a FOOD PRESENTATION AND LABELING
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Clean equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Clean equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin or other forms of contamination. Non-food items shall be stored and displayed separate from food and food-contact surfaces. During pauses in food preparation utensils shall be stored with handles above the top of the food, on a clean sanitized surface, in running water, or in water that is at least 135F. Single-use articles and multiservice utensils shall be handled, displayed, and dispensed so that contamination of food and lip-contact surfaces is prevented. Pressurized cylinders shall be securely fastened to rigid structure. (114074, 114081, 114119, 114121, 114161, 114172, 114178, 114179, 114083, 114185, 114185.2, 114185.3, 114185.4, 114185.5) # 44a PREMISES KEPT FREE OF UNUSED EQUIPMENT
CODE DESCRIPTION: The premises of a food facility shall be kept free of items that are unnecessary to the operation or maintenance of the facility, such as equipment that is nonfunctional or no longer used. (114257.1.) # 44c MOP SINK AND JANITORIAL AREA
# 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES
# 47a SIGNS POSTED AS REQUIRED
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN OBSERVATIONS: Unclean floors in some areas. See report date 10/1/15 for corrective actions.

# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION

# 22 SEWAGE AND WASTEWATER DISPOSAL
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 47c INSPECTION REPORT AVAILABILITY

Facility Name: CVS PHARMACY #182
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 47a SIGNS POSTED AS REQUIRED

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED

# 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES
CODE DESCRIPTION: An accurate easily readable metal probe thermometer suitable for measuring temperature of food shall be available to the food handler. Thermometers shall be calibrated in accordance with manufacturer's specifications as necessary to ensure their accuracy. A thermometer shall be provided for all refrigerators, hot and cold holding units, and high temperature warewashing machines. (114157, 114159) # 43 RESTROOMS MAINTAINED, SUPPLIED, AND ACCESSIBLE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Toilet facilities shall be maintained and kept clean. Toilet rooms shall be separated by a well-fitting self-closing door. Toilet tissue shall be provided in a permanently installed dispenser at each toilet. The number of toilet facilities shall be in accordance with local building and plumbing ordinances. Toilet facilities shall be provided for patrons: in establishments with more than 20,000 sq. ft.; establishments offering on-site consumption of food. (114250, 114250.1, 114276) # 44a PREMISES KEPT FREE OF UNUSED EQUIPMENT
CODE DESCRIPTION: The premises of a food facility shall be kept free of items that are unnecessary to the operation or maintenance of the facility, such as equipment that is nonfunctional or no longer used. (114257.1.) # 50 IMPOUNDMENT OF FOOD, UTENSILS, AND EQUIPMENT
1) chicken wing batter/ 2 cups/ see #7 2) ground beef/ 3 cups/ see #7

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 15 FOOD OBTAINED FROM APPROVED SOURCE
# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

Facility Name: SUBWAY #50556
# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 5a HANDWASHING PROCEDURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Employees are required to wash their hands in the following situations: before engaging in food preparation, after touching bare skin, after using the toilet room, after coughing or sneezing, after eating, drinking, or using tobacco, after handling soiled equipment or utensils, as often as necessary during food preparation to prevent cross-contamination, when switching from working with raw to ready to eat foods, before donning gloves, before dispensing or serving food, after engaging in other activities that may contaminate hands. (113952, 113953.3, 113953.4) # 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES

CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 32a FOOD PRESENTATION AND LABELING
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food offered for human consumption shall be honestly presented in a way that does not mislead or misinform the consumer. Food packaged in a food facility shall bear a label that complies with the labeling requirements prescribed by the Sherman Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Law which include: common name of the food, ingredients list, quantity of contents, name and address of manufacturer, nutritional information as specified in 21 C.F.R. (114087, 114088, 114089, 114089.1(a, b), 114090, 114093.1) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED

# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING

o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 32a FOOD PRESENTATION AND LABELING

Unclean handwash handles at handsink in walk-in #1. Clean/sanitize today.
Fan grills in walk-in #1 and #3 unclean. REPEAT VIOLATION. Clean within 5 days. CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257)
# 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
OBSERVATIONS: Warm water at handsink in walk-in #1 comes out of faucet at a trickle. Increase water pressure within 4 days. Hands must be washed with warm (100F) water at all times.
CODE DESCRIPTION: Steam tables, ice machines, ice bins, food preparation sinks, display cases, walk-in refrigeration units, and other similar equipment that discharge liquid waste shall drain into a floor sink with an air gap or other approved type of receptor. Plumbing and plumbing fixtures shall be maintained so as to prevent contamination, shall be kept clean, fully operative, and in good repair. The potable water supply shall be protected with a backflow or back siphonage protection device. Any hose used for potable water shall be of approved materials, labeled, properly stored, and used for no other purpose. (114171, 114190, 114192, 114193, 114193.1, 114199, 114201, 114269) # 44c MOP SINK AND JANITORIAL AREA OBSERVATIONS: Mop room lacks mop rack for hanging mops. Correct within 7 days.

# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
# 42 GARBAGE AND REFUSE DISPOSAL
# 44c MOP SINK AND JANITORIAL AREA
# 44e VERMIN AND ANIMAL EXCLUSION
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
CODE DESCRIPTION: All poisonous substances, detergents, sanitizers, and cleaning compounds shall be stored to prevent contamination of food, equipment, utensils, linens, and single-use articles. Only pesticides that are necessary and specifically approved for use in a food facility may be used. Containers of poisonous or toxic materials shall have a legible manufacturer's label or if taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. (114254, 114254.1, 114254.2) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Containers holding food or food ingredients that are removed from their original packaging shall be identified with the common name of the food. (114051) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Wiping cloths used to clean food and nonfood-contact surfaces shall be used only once unless kept in clean water with a sanitizer solution of 100 ppm available chlorine or 200 ppm quaternary ammonium. Sponges shall not be used on food-contact surfaces. Except for fabric implements, linen shall not be used in contact with food. (114099.6, 114135, 114185.1, 114185.3 (d-e)). # 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Steam tables, ice machines, ice bins, food preparation sinks, display cases, walk-in refrigeration units, and other similar equipment that discharge liquid waste shall drain into a floor sink with an air gap or other approved type of receptor. Plumbing and plumbing fixtures shall be maintained so as to prevent contamination, shall be kept clean, fully operative, and in good repair. The potable water supply shall be protected with a backflow or back siphonage protection device. Any hose used for potable water shall be of approved materials, labeled, properly stored, and used for no other purpose. (114171, 114190, 114192, 114193, 114193.1, 114199, 114201, 114269) # 50 IMPOUNDMENT OF FOOD, UTENSILS, AND EQUIPMENT

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 1a DEMONSTRATION OF KNOWLEDGE
# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 5b BARE HAND CONTACT AND GLOVE USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Employees shall minimize bare hand contact with nonprepackaged ready-to-eat food. Single-use gloves shall be used for only one task and shall be discarded when damaged or soiled, or when interruptions in the food handling occur. Gloves shall be changed as often as handwashing is required. Slash-resistant gloves may be used with ready-to-eat food if the gloves have a smooth, durable, nonabsorbent surface, or are covered with a single-use glove. (113961, 113973 (b,c,e)) # 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS

# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
# 42 GARBAGE AND REFUSE DISPOSAL

# 1a DEMONSTRATION OF KNOWLEDGE
# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
# 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS

# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 42 GARBAGE AND REFUSE DISPOSAL
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
ITEM #6 BACK HAND WASH SINK PARTIALLY BLOCKED BY A STEP LADDER. CORRECTED DURING INSPECTION.
ITEM #7 MAJOR VIOLATION: BEEF STRIPS IN A PAPER BOAT, HELD AT THE PREP LINE COLD TOP, MEASURED AT 57 DEGREES F. PER STAFF, CONTAINER WAS LEFT OUT FOR 10 MINUTES FOR THE TRANSFER OF FRESH PRODUCT. FOOD ITEM STILL WITHIN THE 4 HOUR COLD HOLDING TIME FRAME. INSTRUCTED STAFF TO MOVE THE FOOD ITEM TO ANOTHER REFRIGERATOR, AND BRING FRESH PRODUCT BACK TO THE PREP LINE. CORRECTED DURING INSPECTION.
ITEM #35 WHEN TURNED THE HOT WATER ON AT THE 3 COMPARTMENT SINK, THE FAUCET POPPED OFF AND WATER WAS SPLASHING EVERYWHERE. REPAIR FAUCET WITHIN 7 DAYS.
ITEM #41 SLOW LEAK AT PIPE LOCATED UNDERNEATH THE 3 COMPARTMENT SINK. CORRECT WITHIN 14 DAYS.
ITEM #44 FLOOR DRAIN .WHICH IS LOCATED IN THE CORNER BY THE C02 GAS CYLINDERS. HAS 1/4 INCH OPENINGS IN THE METAL COVER. PROVIDE SCREEN MESH TO COVER THE HOLE UNDERNEATH THE METAL COVER TO PREVENT ENTRANCE OF INSECTS ANDVERMIN. CORRECT WITHIN 14 DAYS.

# 13 FOOD IN GOOD CONDITION, SAFE, AND UNADULTERATED
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 32a FOOD PRESENTATION AND LABELING
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 44a PREMISES KEPT FREE OF UNUSED EQUIPMENT
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)

# 15 FOOD OBTAINED FROM APPROVED SOURCE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be obtained from an approved sources that comply with all applicable laws. Food shall be transported in an approved manner. Food stored or prepared in a private home shall not be used or offered for sale in a food facility. (113982, 114021, 114023, 114024, 114027, 114029, 114031, 114041) # 32a FOOD PRESENTATION AND LABELING

# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS OBSERVATIONS: Employees lack food handler cards. See routine inspection report for details.
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded or VCD completed (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Steam tables, ice machines, ice bins, food preparation sinks, display cases, walk-in refrigeration units, and other similar equipment that discharge liquid waste shall drain into a floor sink with an air gap or other approved type of receptor. Plumbing and plumbing fixtures shall be maintained so as to prevent contamination, shall be kept clean, fully operative, and in good repair. The potable water supply shall be protected with a backflow or back siphonage protection device. Any hose used for potable water shall be of approved materials, labeled, properly stored, and used for no other purpose. (114171, 114190, 114192, 114193, 114193.1, 114199, 114201, 114269) # 43 RESTROOMS MAINTAINED, SUPPLIED, AND ACCESSIBLE
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)

Facility Name: CVS/ PHARMACY #5225
# 22 SEWAGE AND WASTEWATER DISPOSAL
# 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
# 38 VENTILATION AND LIGHTING
# 42 GARBAGE AND REFUSE DISPOSAL
Facility Name: CVS/ PHARMACY #5225
# 44c MOP SINK AND JANITORIAL AREA
# 44d EMPLOYEE PERSONAL ITEMS
Facility Name: CVS/ PHARMACY #5225
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food contact surfaces, utensils, and equipment shall be cleaned and sanitized at the following times: before each use with different type of raw food of animal origin, when changing from raw food to ready to eat food, between uses with raw produce and potentially hazardous food, before using a thermometer, any time during the operation when contamination may have occurred. Food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. (114113, 114115, 114117, 114125(b), 114141) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. (113953, 113953.1, 113953.2) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION

# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Wiping cloths used to clean food and nonfood-contact surfaces shall be used only once unless kept in clean water with a sanitizer solution of 100 ppm available chlorine or 200 ppm quaternary ammonium. Sponges shall not be used on food-contact surfaces. Except for fabric implements, linen shall not be used in contact with food. (114099.6, 114135, 114185.1, 114185.3 (d-e)). # 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION

# 1b FOOD SAFETY CERTIFICATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food facilities that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall have an employee who has passed an approved food safety certification examination. (113947.1) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN OBSERVATIONS: Build up in bottom of 1 door reach in freezer. Correct - 3 days.

# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION

# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. # 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food items shall be stored at least six inches above the floor in an approved location within the fully enclosed permitted food facility. Food shall not be exposed to splash, dust, vermin, or other forms of contamination or adulteration. Prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with ice if the food is subject to the entry of water because of the nature of it's packaging. Non-prepackaged food may not be stored in direct contact with undrained ice. (114047, 114049, 114053, 114055, 114069 (b)) # 32a FOOD PRESENTATION AND LABELING
# 34 WAREWASHING FACILITIES AND TESTING METHODS
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
Facility Name: EL POLLO LOCO #6106
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 23 VERMIN AND ANIMAL CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: A food facility shall at all times be equipped, maintained, and operated as to prevent the entrance and harborage of animals, birds, and vermin, including, but not limited to rodents and insects. (114259, 114259.1, 114259.4, 114259.5) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 41 PLUMBING FIXTURES AND BACKFLOW PREVENTION

# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Handwashing facilities shall be provided within or adjacent to toilet rooms, food preparation, and warewashing areas. Handwashing facilities shall be clean, unobstructed, and accessible at all times. Handwashing facilities shall be provided with soap and sanitary single-use towels or heated-air hand drying device in approved dispensers. Dispensers shall be maintained in good repair. # 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 5a HANDWASHING PROCEDURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Employees are required to wash their hands in the following situations: before engaging in food preparation, after touching bare skin, after using the toilet room, after coughing or sneezing, after eating, drinking, or using tobacco, after handling soiled equipment or utensils, as often as necessary during food preparation to prevent cross-contamination, when switching from working with raw to ready to eat foods, before donning gloves, before dispensing or serving food, after engaging in other activities that may contaminate hands. (113952, 113953.3, 113953.4) # 5b BARE HAND CONTACT AND GLOVE USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Employees shall minimize bare hand contact with nonprepackaged ready-to-eat food. Single-use gloves shall be used for only one task and shall be discarded when damaged or soiled, or when interruptions in the food handling occur. Gloves shall be changed as often as handwashing is required. Slash-resistant gloves may be used with ready-to-eat food if the gloves have a smooth, durable, nonabsorbent surface, or are covered with a single-use glove. (113961, 113973 (b,c,e)) # 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 9 COOLING METHODS

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 14a FOOD CONTACT SURFACES CLEANED AND SANITIZED

# 8 TIME AS A PUBLIC HEALTH CONTROL
# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
# 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED
Address: 7701 LAGUNA BLVD #420
# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED OBSERVATIONS: 1 of 3 door handles on reach in freezer across fryers is damaged. Correct within 30 days.

# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
# 42 GARBAGE AND REFUSE DISPOSAL
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
1. MAJOR VIOLATION: Missing paper towels and dispenser inside kitchen and ADA compliant restrooms. (see #6) Provide enclosed paper towel dispensers and maintain paper towels in approved dispensers at all times correct within 24 hours. Temporarily corrected by placing napkins and paper towels next to handwash stations. Ensure all handwash stations supplied with soap and paper towels and are easily accessible at all times.
2. Dried food residue build up on pans inside warmer unit. (see #33) Per operator, vendor who delivers food brings and takes pans. Ensure pans are clean at all times. Correct within 24 hours.
3. Lights out at serving service area and operator was unable to turn lights on. (see #38) Ensure lights are properly functional at all times. Correct within 2 days.
4. Missing shatter proof covers for lighting in kitchen area above clean fruit storage. (see #38) Install within 14 days.
5. Missing probe thermometer. (see #39) Provide within 7 days.
6. Observed water leak from faucet at mop sink. (see #41) Investigate and repair leak within 14 days.
7. Found unapproved multi-use utensils (tongs and ladles) on metal rack inside kitchen area. Per operator, ladles were used to dispense corn and were rinsed inside handwash station. (see #44b) As was noted during facility evaluation inspection, facility is not allowed to use multi-use utensils since facility is not equipped with warewash sink. Facility may only use disposable utensils. Remove unapproved equipment today.

1. MAJOR VIOLATION: Missing paper towels and dispenser inside kitchen and ADA compliant restrooms. (see #6) Provide enclosed paper towel dispensers and maintain paper towels in approved dispensers at all times correct within 24 hours. Temporarily corrected by placing napkins and paper towels next to handwash stations. Ensure all handwash stations supplied with soap and paper towels and are easily accessible at all times.
2. Dried food residue build up on pans inside warmer unit. (see #33) Per operator, vendor who delivers food brings and takes pans. Ensure pans are clean at all times. Correct within 24 hours.
3. Lights out at serving service area and operator was unable to turn lights on. (see #38) Ensure lights are properly functional at all times. Correct within 2 days.
4. Missing shatter proof covers for lighting in kitchen area above clean fruit storage. (see #38) Install within 14 days.
5. Missing probe thermometer. (see #39) Provide within 7 days.
6. Observed water leak from faucet at mop sink. (see #41) Investigate and repair leak within 14 days.
7. Found unapproved multi-use utensils (tongs and ladles) on metal rack inside kitchen area. Per operator, ladles were used to dispense corn and were rinsed inside handwash station. (see #44b) As was noted during facility evaluation inspection, facility is not allowed to use multi-use utensils since facility is not equipped with warewash sink. Facility may only use disposable utensils. Remove unapproved equipment today.

# 1c FOOD HANDLER CARDS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food handlers that prepare, handle, or serve non-prepackaged potentially hazardous food, shall obtain a valid Food Handler Card within 30 days after date of hire. (113948) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

# 33 NONFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES CLEAN
CODE DESCRIPTION: Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, food residue, and other debris. Interior premises of a food facility shall be kept clean. (114115 (b), 114257) # 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED

# 8 TIME AS A PUBLIC HEALTH CONTROL
CODE DESCRIPTION: When time as a public health control is used, the following procedures shall be observed: food items shall be marked to indicate four hours past the time when the food was removed from temperature control, food shall be served or discarded within the four-hour time limit, written procedures for food that was prepared, cooked, and refrigerated before time as a public health control was used, shall be maintained at the food facility and be made available to the enforcement agency upon request. (114000) # 1a DEMONSTRATION OF KNOWLEDGE
# 29 IDENTIFICATION AND STORAGE OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Wiping cloths used to clean food and nonfood-contact surfaces shall be used only once unless kept in clean water with a sanitizer solution of 100 ppm available chlorine or 200 ppm quaternary ammonium. Sponges shall not be used on food-contact surfaces. Except for fabric implements, linen shall not be used in contact with food. (114099.6, 114135, 114185.1, 114185.3 (d-e)). # 42 GARBAGE AND REFUSE DISPOSAL
# 47a SIGNS POSTED AS REQUIRED

o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
CODE DESCRIPTION: An adequate, protected, pressurized, potable supply of hot and cold water shall be provided at all times. Hot water shall be supplied at a minimum temperature of at least 120F when measured from the faucet. The temperature of water provided to handwashing facilities shall be at least 100F. Handwashing facilities equipped with auto run faucets shall have their water temperature set between 100F to 108F. (113953(c), 114101(d), 114189, 114192, 114192.1, 114195) # 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
CODE DESCRIPTION: Food shall be protected from contamination during transportation, storage, preparation, holding, and display. Food and condiments on display shall be protected from contamination by the use of dispensers, packaging, counter, service line, or sneeze guards that intercept a direct line between the consumer's mouth and the food being displayed. Only prepackaged non-potentially hazardous food or uncut produce may be displayed or sold outdoors if under overhead cover. Open-air barbecues shall be separated from public access. (113984 (a-f), 113986, 114060, 114067, 114069, 114077, 114089.1 (c), 114143 (c-e)) # 39 TEMPERATURE MEASURING DEVICES
# 40 WIPING CLOTHS STORAGE AND USE

o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 1a DEMONSTRATION OF KNOWLEDGE
# 4 EATING, DRINKING, OR TOBACCO USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Employees shall not eat, drink, or use tobacco in any area where contamination of food, clean equipment and utensils, linens, and single use articles may occur. Employees may drink from closed beverage container if the container is handled to prevent contamination of the employee's hands, the container, nonprepackaged food, and food-contact surfaces. Area designated for employees to eat and drink shall be located so that food, clean equipment and utensils, linens, and single-use articles are protected from contamination. (113977, 114256 (a)) # 9 COOLING METHODS
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be rapidly cooled from 135F to 70F within 2 hours, and then from 70F to 41F within 4 hours. Cooling shall be by one or more of the following methods: in shallow containers, separating food into smaller portions, adding ice as an ingredient, using an ice bath, stirring frequently, using rapid cooling equipment, or using containers that facilitate heat transfer. (114002, 114002.1) # 30a FOOD STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
# 4 EATING, DRINKING, OR TOBACCO USE
# 6 HANDWASHING FACILITIES
# 14b WAREWASHING AND SANITIZING PROCEDURES
# 27 FOOD PROTECTED FROM CONTAMINATION
# 30b FOOD CONTAINERS LABELED
# 35 EQUIPMENT APPROVED AND MAINTAINED
CODE DESCRIPTION: Utensils and equipment shall be kept fully operative and in good repair. All new and replacement equipment shall be properly installed and be certified by NSF, UL Sanitation, or ETL Sanitation. Facilities that wash, rinse, soak, thaw, or similarly prepare foods shall be provided with a approved food preparation sink. Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced or replaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized. (114130, 114130.1, 114130.2, 114130.3, 114130.4, 114130.5, 114130.6, 114132, 114133, 114137, 114139, 114153, 114163, 114165, 114169, 114175, 114177, 114180) # 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION

# 43 RESTROOMS MAINTAINED, SUPPLIED, AND ACCESSIBLE

# 45 FLOOR, WALL, AND CEILING FINISHES

o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 5b BARE HAND CONTACT AND GLOVE USE
CODE DESCRIPTION: Employees shall minimize bare hand contact with nonprepackaged ready-to-eat food. Single-use gloves shall be used for only one task and shall be discarded when damaged or soiled, or when interruptions in the food handling occur. Gloves shall be changed as often as handwashing is required. Slash-resistant gloves may be used with ready-to-eat food if the gloves have a smooth, durable, nonabsorbent surface, or are covered with a single-use glove. (113961, 113973 (b,c,e)) # 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
# 36 EQUIPMENT STORED IN APPROVED LOCATION
o Photographic documentation obtained o Compliance conference required o Food / equipment impounded (50) o Food safety education required; # of employees o Permit Suspension; facility closure required (51)
# 7 HOT AND COLD HOLDING TEMPERATURES
CODE DESCRIPTION: Potentially hazardous foods shall be maintained at or below 41F or at or above 135F. The following foods may be held at or below 45F: raw shell eggs, unshucked live molluscan shellfish, pasteurized milk and pasteurized milk products in original sealed containers, potentially hazardous foods held during transportation. Food preparation shall not exceed two cumulative hours without a return to the required holding temperatures. (113996, 113998, 114037) # 21 HOT AND COLD WATER SUPPLY
hotdogs / roller#2 / 139.00 ºF pizza / warmer / 152.00 ºF
